loans.name: Sadika

texts.en: Sadika was born  in 1965 and she lives with her husband in Vitez. Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly salary is 1 200 KM. They sell agriculture and milk products in order to increase their monthly incomes. They can earn about 400 KM monthly. Sadika will use this loan in the amount of 1200 KM  for buying nylon for her greenhouse. She wants to expand the business and build a bigger greenhouse in the future.

loans.use: Buying nylon for her greenhouse.

loans.name: Zehra

texts.en: Zehra was born in 1942 and she is married. She lives  with her husband in Kruščica, a small village near the town Vitez. Her husband is a pensioner and his monthly pension is 375 KM. By selling milk and milk products they get additional money in the amount of 300 KM monthly. She has 7 children from 26- 46 years old.  This is her fifth loan that she took at MCO WWI. Zehra will use this loan in the amount of 1200 KM for buying  a cow.  She sells milk to the diary plant and she hopes that with this new cow, her milk will be of higher quality.

loans.use: Buying  a cow.

loans.name: Maria Angélica

texts.es:
Maria Angélica has been a single mother of six children for the past 12 years. She has been selling clothes in a local market for 25 years. However, her business isn’t restricted to this field. Twelve years ago, she encountered the opportunity to be part of a school supplies fair and took her chances. From February to May, she now runs a bookstore at the fair. During those four months she is exclusively devoted to this business, resuming clothes sales the rest of the year.

She destined part of the income to her children, while the rest was invested back in her business or saved in order to buy a strip of land. Maria Angélica is very proud of having built four rooms in the land she acquired with her savings, which she now rents to four families. When it comes to her children, tiredness doesn’t exist and her strenght never falters.

Even with all she has accomplished to date, she still dreams of building a bazaar at her house, which would be more profitable and require less hard work than selling her products at the fair or the market.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Angélica es madre soltera de seis hijos desde hace doce años. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en un mercado hace veinticinco años. Aunque no es el único rubro al que se enfoca, hace doce años, al ver la oportunidad de formar parte de una feria de útiles escolares se animó y, de febrero a mayo, maneja una librería en la feria. En estos cuatro meses se dedica integra a este negocio y retoma la venta de ropa en los meses restantes.

Si bien el dinero que ganaba de su trabajo en gran parte lo destinaba a sus hijos, otra parte lo reinvertía en sus negocios y lo que restaba lo ahorraba para la compra de un terreno. Hoy en día, Maria Angélica se siente orgullosa de haber llegado a construir cuatro habitaciones en aquel terreno que llegó a comprar y que ahora lo alquila a cuatro familias. Y es que cuando se trata de sus hijos no hay fuerzas que le falten y cansancio que exista.

Con todo lo logrado hasta ahora, ella sueña aún con construir una tienda bazar en su casa, porque es más rentable y además porque el trabajo no es tan pesado como la venta de sus productos en el mercado y la feria.

loans.use: Set up a bazaar at home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Armina

texts.en: Armina was born in 1977  and she is married. She lives  with her husband and 2 children in Nemila, near the town Zenica. Her husband does seasonal agriculture work and  can earn about 600 KM monthly. Armina  crochets and she intends to use this loan in the amount of 1000 KM for buying material for crochet. She hopes that she will increase her household income by selling her handmade work.

loans.use: Buying material for crochet.

loans.name: Seada

texts.en: Seada is from Nemila, a suburb of the town Zenica. She was born in 1984 and she lives with her family. She sells cosmetic products and she can earn about 200 KM monthly. Her father has a full –time job and his monthly salary is 1000 KM.This is her second loan at the MCO WWI and she will use it for buying and selling cosmetic products in order to improve their living standards.

loans.use: Buying and selling cosmetic products.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
For Arturo, it all began with his move to one of the new districts in Lima, Carabayllo. When he arrived to set up home in the area, few people lived there, and therefore business was at a minimum. Seeing that so many of his neighbours, just like him, had to walk quite a way before finding any shops, he decided to open up his own small shop. Little by little, and with a lot of hard work, Arturo improved his shop and invested in it until he was able to supply groceries, fruit and veg. He confirms that it was very hard to start with, and accessing his house was difficult for suppliers. And so he had to carry goods from the road to his house. But he chose not to give up despite this problem, he felt that the advantages of the business were not only for him but also for the community. Today, in addition to running his store, construction of his drinks area is in progress.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Para Arturo todo empezó con su mudanza a uno de los nuevos distritos de Lima, Carabayllo. Cuando él llegó a vivir en esta zona, los habitantes eran muy pocos, por ello, la presencia de comercio era mínima. Al ver que tanto sus vecinos como él debían caminar varias cuadras antes de encontrar una tienda, se animo a poner una pequeña. Fue así que poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo Arturo fue mejorando su tienda e invirtiendo en ella hasta abastecerla de abarrotes, frutas y verduras. El afirma que le fue muy difícil al inicio, ya que el acceso a su casa no era muy fácil para los proveedores. Entonces el debía cargar la mercadería desde la carretera hasta su casa. Pero él no desistió al ver este problema, pues el sentía que la ganancia no solo era para el sino que también para la comunidad. En la actualidad, además de manejar su bodega, la construcción de su distribuidora de gas y cerveza está en camino.

loans.use: To invest in his new project, selling fizzy drinks and beer.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Three and a half years ago, Margarita ran the grocery store, with much dedication, which she managed from within her home. The idea to start up this business came from her desire to stand out and help her husband with the family income. At the start, she only sold fizzy drinks and any profit she made she invests back into the business to buy more products. During this time she had a dream to have a shop, but one with a larger selection of goods. Just two years ago, with the help of EDAPROSPO she can see the profits, although she still dreams about a shop. Margarita’s aim is to have a larger sale stand in a market, within a couple of years. But she knows that it will take at least a few years for her dream to become a reality. For the time being, she wants to extend the selection of goods for offer in her store. And she continues to support the education of her four children.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Hace tres años y medio que Margarita atiende con mucha dedicación en la bodega que maneja dentro de su casa. La idea de abrir este negocio nació con las ganas de sobresalir y apoyar a su esposo con el ingreso económico al hogar. En un inicio solo vendía gaseosas y lo que ganaba de ello lo volvía a invertir en comprar más productos. Durante un tiempo estuvo haciendo lo mismo, ya que su sueño era tener una tienda, pero una que bien surtida. Recién hace dos años y con la ayuda de EDAPROSPO puede ver ganancias de su trabajo, aunque una parte de ello lo sigue destinando a su tienda. El objetivo de Margarita dentro de unos años es tener un puesto de venta mayorista en un mercado. Pero sabe que aun le falta al menos unos años para poder empezar a realizar este sueño. Por ahora, quiere implementar su bodega con diversos artículos. Y seguir apoyando en la educación de sus cuatro hijos

loans.use: Increase the selection of products within her store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
Mr. N. will strengthen his working capital by buying products from wholesalers to stock his neighborhood shop. He started off with his own money and demand is becoming stronger stronger, which is why he needs this loan. He is a serious and hard-working young man.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur N. va renforcer son fonds de roulement en achetant des produits chez les grossistes pour alimenter sa boutique de quartier. il a demarré avec ses fonds propres et la demande devient de plus en plus forte et cela explique son besoin. c'est un jeune serieux et travailleur.

loans.use: Strengthening shop working capital

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for UIMCEC, a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Lusmery

texts.es:
Lusmery is fifty years old. She has been seperated form her husband for 16 years, which is why she was forced to work in a factory, welding steel tools. Nevertheless, she has to abandon this after ten years of hard work due to an accident. She recalls that she was doing her daily work when suddenly a big tool fell on top of her. The doctor said she could not return to work after that. This was reason enough for her to immediately look for another way to earn a living. So she began making clothing with the little knowledge she had about dressmaking. But, at the same time, she took a course about how to prepare fertilizer and plant flowerpots. This is why she know works selling clothing and also plants. What she would like most is to buy the machines needed to improve the way she makes clothes, since she can’t currently achieve a good finish on her garments and their low quality leads to a low selling price. Lusmery’s needs increase when you take into account the education of her youngest daughter and the cardiac health care needed by her oldest daughter..

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Lusmery es una mujer de cincuenta años. Desde hace 16 años que esta separada de su esposo, razón por la cual se vio obligada a trabajar en una fábrica soldando herramientas de acero. No obstante tuvo que abandonarlo después de diez años de trabajo arduo a causa de un accidente que tuvo. Ella cuenta que cuando se encontraba en una faena diaria de repente le cae un fierro grande encima. Y el doctor le prohibió volver a aquel trabajo. Motivo suficiente para que de inmediato busque otra forma de ganarse la vida. Así que empezó a confeccionar ropa con los pocos conocimientos que recordaba sobre costura. Pero a la par también aprovecho para tomar un curso sobre cómo preparar abono y plantar en macetas. Es así que ahora se dedica a vender ropa y también a vender plantas. Lo que más le gustaría a ella es poder comprar las maquinarias necesarias para una mejor confección de sus productos, ya que no le puede dar un buen acabado a sus prendas y su baja calidad desmerecen un buen precio de venta. Las necesidades de Lusmery crecen cuando debe tomar en cuenta la educación de su hija menor y los cuidados de la enfermedad cardiaca de su hija mayor..

loans.use: To purchase machines to improve the finish of her clothing

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Lê Thị Đào, 54, joined TYM fund 4 years ago. Before joining TYM, her family was living in difficult condition. They could only rely on the revenue generated by their small rice field. They have 2 young children who attend school so the expenses add up. So when TYM started operating in her area, she and her husband had decided to borrow money to invest in a butcher stand. In the beginning, their sales were small. Since they buy their beef directly from supplier they were able to make good profit. Sales had increased and they have been able to save money. With subsequent loans from TYM, they invested in their butcher shop. Now their financial difficulty is over, they can assure good education for their children. Mrs Đào also raises cattle in her free time. This time she's requesting a loan of 575 USD to buy cows.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Đào, 44 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương được 4 năm. Trước đây khi chưa tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị gặp nhiều khó khăn, mọi chi tiêu trong gia đình chỉ trông vào mấy sào ruộng. Chị còn nuôi 2 con đi học nên càng vất vả. Từ khi có Quỹ Tình Thương về hoạt động, chị đã bàn bạc cùng chồng và thống nhất vay vốn đầu tư mổ trâu, bò. Ban đầu chị Đào chỉ mổ với số lượng ít. Với mô hình mua tận gốc bán tận ngọn dần dần chị đã tích góp được số vốn kha khá. Cộng với mức vốn vay của Quỹ tăng dần hàng năm đến nay số lượng hàng bán mỗi ngày tăng lên rõ rệt. Kinh tế gia đình phát triển rõ rệt, các con có điều kiện ăn học tốt, chị Đào vẫn có thời gian để chăn nuôi thêm. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 575USD mua bò.

loans.use: Buy cows

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Hiền, 31 years old, is an active and business-minded woman. She joins the TYM Fund in 2002. Not seeing any construction material store in the area, she talks to her husband then with funds from a loan together with their savings, she opens a shop at home. The shop gets popular and business is ever better. It brings in an income of 250USD a month. Her husband with a stable laboring job also helps. She is applying for a loan of 775USD to stock up her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Hiền, 31 tuổi, là nguời phụ nữ năng động nhạnh nhẹn có đầu óc kinh doanh. Năm 2002 chị tham gia vào Quỹ. Nhận thấy trên địa bàn chưa có cửa hàng kinh doanh nguyên vật liệu nào, trong khi nhu cầu xây dựng đang phát triển, chị Hiền đã bàn bạc với chồng và quyết định mở cửa hàng kinh doanh vật liệu tại nhà. Với những đồng vốn tích lũy từ trước cộng thêm vốn vay của Quỹ, cửa hàng của gia đình chị đã nhanh chóng hoạt động tốt. Giá cả hợp lý, cửa hàng ngày càng thu hút đông khách hàng quanh địa phương. Công việc kinh doanh ngày một phát triển, chồng chị lại có nghề nghiệp ổn định (làm công nhân) nên đời sống gia đình thuộc hộ khá tại địa phương. Vòng vốn này chị Hiền tiếp tục vay 775USD mua vật liệu. Thu nhập bình quân của cửa hàng là 250USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị H., 49 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2004. She has reputation of a good standing member. She use funds from loans properly and efficiently. Her husband and her son go sea fishing. Each trip takes several days. She sells the fish at the open market. Everyone has to work to support the family. She is applying for a loan of 400USD to buy net and tools. The income is steady at 200USD monthly.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị H., 49 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2004. Trải qua 4 năm tham gia Quỹ chị luôn gương mẫu chấp hành tốt mọi quy chế, quy định của Quỹ. Việc sử dụng vốn luôn đúng mục đích và đem lại hiệu quả cao. Chồng và con chị làm nghề đánh cá. Mỗi lần ra biển thường kéo dài vài ngày. Khi có cá thì chị H. là người trực tiếp đem ra chợ bán. Công việc đánh bắt diễn ra đều đặn, mọi người trong gia đình đều được phân công công việc rõ ràng và hợp lý. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 400USD để mua thêm lưới và một số vật dụng khác phục vụ việc đánh cá. Thu nhập từ đánh cá bình quân 200USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy fishing-net

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị L. is healthy and active at her age. She has 5 children. All are grown up, married and moved out. She takes out loan to finance her fish selling business. In addition, she raises few poultry and pigs. Her monthly income is 200USD. She is applying a loan of 400USD to finance her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Mặc dù tuổi đã cao nhưng chị Lê Thị L. còn khoẻ mạnh và là lao động chính trong gia đình. Việc vay vốn trả theo tuần cũng thuận lợi với điều kiện gia đình nên vòng vốn nào chị cũng vay đầu tư vào việc buôn cá tại chợ địa phương. Ngoài ra chị L. còn chăn nuôi gà, lợn. Từ những dự án thiết thực đó kinh tế gia đình ngày càng phát triển. Các con của chị đã trưởng thành, 5 người con đã xây dựng gia đình và đều có nhà riêng. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục vay 400USD để cá bán. Thu nhập bình quân của chị là 200USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy fishes

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi M., 57 years old, has spent hard years with her husband, trying to raise their three children.  Now, all of Mrs. M.'s children have a job.  Thus, they have the opportunities to help their parents.  As an independent, hardingworking woman, Mrs. M., however, does not want to depend on her children.  Being a TYM FUND member for four years, she has used every loan to invest on pig breeding.  Her work is in good shape, and it makes her very happy.  This time she intends to borrow 400USD to buy pigs.  Her monthly income is about 230USD.  She is now able to help her children if they are in financial needs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Mười, 57 tuổi đã cùng chồng trải qua những năm tháng vất vả nuôi 3 con ăn học. Giờ đây các con chị đã có công ăn việc làm ổn định và có điều kiện phụ giúp cho bố mẹ nhưng với bản tính của 1 người phụ nữ  chăm chỉ, chị Mười không muốn phụ thuộc vào con cái. Tham gia vào Quỹ được 4 năm, vòng vồn nào chị cũng vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Việc chăn nuôi của chị rất thuận lợi, công việc làm chị cảm thấy vui hơn. Vòng vốn này chị 400USD mua lợn về vỗ béo. Thu nhập bình quân một tháng 230USD, chị Mười vẫn có thể hỗ trợ các con khi gặp khó khăn.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Luong Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Luong Thi T., 37 years old, joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2003. Besides farming, her family also makes sedge mats. Her products has good quality so everything that is produced is sold out pretty quickly. There are also many customers who sign contracts with her. Since Mrs. T. became a member of TYM Fund, she has an extra source of fund to buy sedge, so as she can satisfy the demand. Mrs. T.'s children are still in school; all of them are in good care. This loan cycle, Mrs. T. would love to borrow 400USD to buy sedge. Right now, selling sedge mats brings her family an income of 150USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lương Thị Thảo, 37 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2003. Gia đình nhà chị ngoài làm ruộng còn có nghề phụ làm chiếu. Sản phẩm của nhà chị Thảo rất có uy tín làm đến đâu xuất hết đến đó. Bên cạnh đó cũng có rất nhiều khách đến đặt hàng. Từ khi tham gia vào Quỹ, chị đã có thêm nguồn vốn để mua thêm đay, cói nên sản xuất ngày càng thuận tiện, đáp ứng được nhu cầu của khách hàng. Các con chị đang trong độ tuổi đi học, đều được quan tâm chăm sóc. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 400USD mua đay, cói. Thu nhập từ nghề làm chiếu của gia đình là 150USD/tháng

loans.use: Buy sedge to make sedge mat

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
At twenty-nine years old, Yesenia is a hard working woman, with an enterprising character. She has been running her new business for two months. Before that, she had a shop which she managed for a year and a half. However, her sisters-in-law suggested that she started making pillows. Which is why, with two other people, Yesenia decided to leave her shop and start up this new project. Yesenia has a lot of expectations. She works night and day in order to expand her business as quickly as possible. For the time being, anything she earns she invests back into the business. Luckily, her husband takes care of the house and her two young childrem, aged eight and two. For the future, she hopes to update the machines which she has (which are second hand) and extend her business to produce clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

A sus veintinueve años Yesenia es una mujer muy trabajadora y que tiene un espíritu emprendedor. Hace dos meses que maneja su nuevo negocio. Anteriormente, tenia una tienda que la mantuvo durante año y medio. Sin embargo, sus cuñadas le propusieron empezar con la confección de almohadas. Es así que con dos personas más Yesenia se animó dejar su tienda y empezar en este nuevo proyecto. Yesenia esta con muchas expectativas. Y trabaja día y noche para hacer crecer sin demora este negocio. Por ahora, lo que gana lo vuelve a invertir, felizmente su esposo se encarga del mantenimiento del hogar y de sus dos pequeños hijos de ocho y dos años. Lo que ella espera en un futuro es renovar las maquinarias que tiene (ya que son de segunda mano) y extender el rubro de producción a ropa de vestir.

loans.use: Update her sewing machines

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
As a fifth year member of TYM FUND (Kiva Partner in Vietnam), Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 34 years old, has borrowed and successfully repaid many loans. Since the market is right close to her house, Mrs. H. opens a butcher store. Her work is developing quite well. When Mrs. H. is free, she also makes and sells mats, so that her income is very stable. Her two children are still in school. She spends a lot of time taking care of her children. This time she wants to borrow 400USD to buy pork for her store. Her income from the store is 200USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Là thành viên năm thứ 5, chị Nguyễn Thị Hòa, 34 tuổi, đã trải qua nhiều vòng vốn. Chợ ở ngay gần nhà, chị Hòa tận dụng lợi thế này để mở một quầy bán thịt lợn. Công việc buôn bán rất phát triển, những thời gian nhàn rỗi chị lại đan chiếu bán nên thu nhập hàng ngày rất đều đặn. Các con chị 2 cháu còn đang độ tuổi đi học, chị Hòa cũng rất chăm lo và đầu tư cho con. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 400USD đầu tư mau lợn về thịt. Thu nhập bình quân từ bán thịt lợn là 200USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Being a member of TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2003, Ms. Nguyen Thi T., 40 years old, has always tried to follow all the agreements of the loan term. In previous years, her family had a lot of difficulties. Her children were in school, which cost a fortune. Because of the tuition and fees and all the associated costs, there is no fund left for Ms. T. to invest on breeding or any other job. She was afraid to borrow much in the first loans. As time goes by, because of good use of the loan, her family gets a lot of improvement. She also gets used with the monthly payments. Ms. T. wants to borrow 400USD to buy pigs and to make/sell sedge mats.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương từ năm 2003, chị Nguyễn Thị Toàn, 40 tuổi, luôn cố gắng chấp hành tốt mọi quy định của cụm, Quỹ. Những năm trước, gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn, các con chị đang tuổi ăn tuổi học chi phí tốn kém, không có nguồn vốn để phát huy nghề phụ và chăn nuôi thêm. Những vòng vốn đầu chị Toàn chưa mạnh dạn vay mức vốn lớn, sau quá trình sử dụng hiệu quả, kinh tế gia đình bớt đi những khó khăn, việc trả tiền tuần đã dần phù hợp với gia đình chị. Vòng vốn này chị Toàn xin vay mức vốn 400USD đầu tư vào dệt chiếu và chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy pigs and sedge to make sedge mat

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Fifteen years ago, upon moving to her new house, Diana saw the opportunity to sell, at night, food from a moving stall. For fourteen years, she has sold “salchipapas” (hot dogs and French fries) and she has been gaining customers who happily are not lacking. Initially, the idea to start this small business was to give her children food and education since, even with her husband’s income, they did not always have enough. Now that two of their three children have finished high school, she is thinking of continuing to work with the idea of investing in a bigger business. Nevertheless, the income from the sale of food is the only one she has. Besides this, she and her husband receive money from two mototaxis that they bought two years ago. Her dream is to open a restaurant on the main street of her town. For this, she would like to buy one more mototaxi and make it work well.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Una vez que se mudo a su nueva vivienda, hace quince años, Diana vio la oportunidad de vender, por las noches, comida en un puesto ambulante. Ella vende “salchipapas” (papas y hot dog fritos) desde hace catorce años y se ha ido ganando clientes que, felizmente, no le faltan. Inicialmente la idea de poner este pequeño negocio era darles educación y alimento a sus hijos, ya que con el ingreso económico de su esposo no siempre fue suficiente. Ahora que dos hijos de sus tres terminaron el colegio, piensa seguir trabajando con la idea de invertir en un negocio mucho más grande. No obstante, el ingreso de la venta de comida no es el único que tiene, además de eso, su esposo y ella reciben el dinero de los dos Mototaxis que compraron hace dos años. El sueño de ella es poner un restaurante en una avenida principal de su distrito. Para ello le gustaría comprar un Mototaxi más y hacerlo trabajar también.

loans.use: Purchase a mototaxi.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Hà, 32 years old, lives by the seashore. Her husband goes sea fishing, she stays home rice farming and raising few pigs. She also sells fish that brought home by her husband at the open market. Income from fish selling is high, but then he needs money for fishing tools. The family economy gets more stable and their children are taken care better since she joins the TYM Fund. This time she is applying for a loan of 575USD to buy fishing equipment.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Sống gần biển, công việc và nguồn thu chính của gia đình chị Phạm Thị Hà, 32 tuổi, là đánh và bán cá. Hàng ngày anh đi đánh cá, chị ở nhà chăn nuôi và làm ruộng. Mỗi khi có cá chị Hà lại mang ra chợ bán. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ, sử dụng vốn vay có hiệu quả nên gia đình chị đã có những chuyển biến rõ rệt. Kinh tế ổn định hơn trước rất nhiều, chị Hà có thể mua sắm được các vật dụng sinh hoạt có giá trị và có điều kiện chăm sóc con cái hơn. Thu nhập từ nghề đánh cá tương đối cao, nhưng vốn đầu tư vào các dung cụ đánh cá cũng cần nhiều, vòng vốn này chị Hà xin vay 575USD để sắm thêm đồ nghề.

loans.use: Buy fishing tools..

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
At such a young age of 30, Mrs. Tran Thi S. has always wanted to become successful. She joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2005, in order to get the fund to open her tailor store. She borrows the maximum loan in all of her loan cycles. Her store is expanded to satisfy the growing customers' demand. With her skills and her willingness to gain more experiences, Mrs. S.'s tailor store gets a good reputation. Besides, her husband also goes fishing, so her family is doing better and better. This loan cycle, Mrs. S. would like to borrow 525USD to buy clother. Their family income is about 250 to 280USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Tuổi đời còn trẻ nhưng luôn có ý trí làm giầu, chị Trần Thị Sót, 30 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương năm 2005, với mục đích vay vốn đầu tư vào cửa hàng may. Vòng vốn nào chị cũng vay mức vốn tối đa, cửa hiệu của chị ngày càng được mở rộng đáp ứng nhu cầu của khách hàng. Với sự khéo tay và thường xuyên học hỏi kinh nghiệm nên hiệu may của chị Sót rất có uy tín. Ngoài ra, chồng chị Sót còn làm nghề đánh cá nên kinh tế gia đình ngày càng phát triển. Vòng vốn tiếp theo chị Sót xin vay mức vốn 525USD đầu tư mua vải. Thu nhâp bình quân hàng tháng của gia đình từ 250 đến 280USD.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Vien Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Viên Thị Hà, 43 years old, is a fifth tear member of the TYM Fund. She took out many loans from the Fund to invest in her husband’s fishing tools. With better equipped, the fishing business runs smoother, gets higher production and more profitable. This year, she is applying for a loan of 400USD to replace aged tools. The monthly income is 150USD. 

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.  
 
Là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương, chị Viên Thị Hà, 43 tuổi, đã trải qua nhiều vòng vốn. Với gia đình chị, nguồn kiếm sống cơ bản là đánh bắt cá do đó các vòng vốn vay trước của chị đều đầu tư vào mua các vật dụng đánh bắt. Từ khi được trang bị đầy đủ các đồ đánh bắt cá, công việc tiến triển thuận tiện rất nhiều. Lượng cá đánh bắt tăng lên, thu nhập đều đặn, kinh tế phát triển. Sang năm nay, do một số phương tiện đánh bắt đã cũ nên vòng vốn này chị xin vay 400USD để mua thêm đồ nghề. Thu nhập bình quân gia đình 150USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy fishing tools

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vũ Thị Bình, 31 years old, joins the TYM Fund 5 years ago. Her family runs a rice mill, raises pigs and also weaves straw mattresses to make their living. By product from the mill is used as feed for pigs. In average, they churn out 500 Kg of pork a year. The income is good at 200USD a month, the family’s economy is stable. In 2007, they built a new house from their saving. She is applying for a loan of 400USD to invest in the family’s businesses.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Vũ Thị Bình, 31 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ được 5 năm. Công việc hiện nay của gia đình chị là kinh doanh máy xay xát, kết hợp với chăn nuôi lợn, tiết kiệm được gạo và cám dư thừa. Với thuận lợi đó gia đình nhà chị chăn nuôi rất nhiều và có hiệu quả. Bình quân mỗi năm chị Bình cho xuất chuồng 5 tạ lợn thịt. Không chỉ dừng lại ở những việc đó gia đình chị còn làm thêm nghề dệt chiếu. Với nhiều nguồn thu nhập như vậy kinh tế gia đình chị Bình liên tục phát triển. Từ những nguồn thu trên gia đình chị đã dành dụm năm 2007 xây một ngôi nhà mới thật khang trang. Vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình bàn bạc xin vay mức vốn 400USD. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình hiện nay là 200USD/tháng,

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
At her 56 years of age, Juana works as if she was half her age. Since almost thirty years ago, she has sold “seconds” (plates, glasses, plastic bags, etc.) At the beginning, she did not have a permanent shop. As a result, she sold itinerantly and would travel to the provinces on a seasonal basis. Nevertheless, she decided that it would be better to acquire a market stall and sell there since it was less tiring than always moving with all her merchandise. She decided to sell seconds because she thought it would be more profitable. Four years ago, her friend abandoned the only stall selling fish and shellfish in the market. So, she thought it would be a good idea to open one herself. Now she runs both businesses, which allows her to take care of her home and her two youngest children. Her husband also sells seconds but in another area and itinerantly. What she would most like is to be able to purchase both stalls -- because she pays rent daily – and to hire people to work for her.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

A sus cincuenta y seis años Juana trabaja como si tuviera la mitad de su edad. Desde hace casi treinta años vende productos descartables (platos, vasos, bolsas de plástico, etc.). Al inicio ella no tenia un puesto estable, motivo por el cual vendía como ambulante y por temporadas se iba de viaje a provincias. Sin embargo, consideró que seria mejor adquirir un puesto en un mercado y vender ahí ya que era menos trabajoso que estar movilizándose siempre con toda su mercadería. Decidió vender productos descartables porque pensó que era más rentable. Hace cuatro años una compañera abandono el único puesto de venta de pescados y mariscos en el mercado. De este modo, pensó que seria buena idea abrir uno ella misma. Ahora maneja ambos negocios, lo cual le permite mantener su hogar y a sus dos últimos hijos. Su esposo también trabaja vendiendo productos descartables pero en otra zona y como ambulante. Lo que más le gustaría a ella es poder comprar los dos puestos que tiene, porque paga diariamente una cuota de alquiler y contratar a personas que trabajen para ella.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of more products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Having to support her children made Flor rent a small stand in the market and begin selling food. In those days she was having serious problems in her marriage.

For 4 years now Flor gets up very early to begin her sales during breakfast hours. This is what she does every morning, sell her most requested dishes, red noodles and ceviche. She alone, with her 12 year-old sister’s help, tends to her stall. Although she incurred costs to start her business, she says that it has been worthwhile and today she is motivated to work as she now has a newborn son.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La necesidad de mantener a sus hijos llevó a Flor a alquilar un pequeño puesto en el mercado y a empezar a vender comida. En aquel momento pasaba serios problemas en su matrimonio.

Desde hace cuatro años Flor amanece muy temprano para empezar con sus ventas a la hora del desayuno. Es así que todas sus mañanas transcurren vendiendo sus platos más requeridos, tallarines rojos y ceviche. Ella sola, con la ayuda de su hermana de doce años atiende su puesto. Aunque le costo empezar, dice que todo valió la pena y hoy tiene más motivos por el cual trabajar ya que acaba de dar a luz un nuevo hijo.

loans.use: Buy a larger stove and food supplies.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica is an admirable woman possessing the desire to work and the vision to launch new businesses. At her short 20 years of age, she runs three shops in a market. Until four years ago, she worked helping her mother selling food. When her mother heard about the inauguration of a new market, she didn’t hesitate to propose to her daughter that she ought to begin to sell produce from a market stand. Jessica was eager to work and immediately accepted her mother’s proposal. Besides, more income for her family would not have been a bad thing. She has four children and many hopes for them. They are the motor that pushes her the most. Now, she has two produce stands and a book store that has been open for two months with the help of her husband. Her objective is to expand over the next months and buy a photocopier.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Las ganas de trabajar y la visión de emprender nuevos negocios hacen de Jessica una mujer admirable. A sus cortos veinte años maneja tres puestos de venta en un mercado. Hasta hace cuatro años trabajaba ayudando a su mama vendiendo comida. Cuando su mamá se enteró de la inauguración de un nuevo mercado no dudó en proponerle a su hija que empezara a vender verduras en un puesto. Jessica tenía ganas de trabajar así que acepto de inmediato la propuesta de su mamá, además, un ingreso más a su familia no le hubiera ido mal. Ella tiene cuatro hijos y muchas esperanzas en ellos, ellos son el motor que la empuja a crecer más. Ahora tiene dos puestos de verduras y una librería abierta hace dos meses con la ayuda de su esposo, su objetivo es ampliarla en los siguientes meses y comprar una fotocopiadora.

loans.use: Expand her new book store.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa’s work as a cosmetologist in a beauty salon was not very profitable compared to her needs. So, she preferred to abandon it and begin to work as an independent cosmetologist. For periods, she also itinerantly sold some devices that were imported from the south of Peru until she seized the opportunity to acquire a shop in the new market near her house. It has already been four years that she has been selling school supplies. Thanks to this business’ income and the help of her husband who always supports her, she has been able to provide education to her two children. In her plans for the future is the construction of her shop, a space in which she wishes to provide cosmetology services.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Su trabajo como cosmetóloga en un salón de belleza no le era muy rentable comparado a las necesidades que tenia Teresa. De modo que prefirió abandonarlo y empezó a trabajar como cosmetóloga independiente. Por periodos también vendía como ambulante algunos artefactos que importaba del sur del Perú. Hasta que tuvo la oportunidad de adquirir un puesto en el nuevo mercado cerca de su casa. Desde hace ya cuatro años que vende productos escolares. Gracias al ingreso de este negocio pudo darles educación a sus dos hijos, con la ayuda también de su esposo que siempre la apoya. Dentro de sus planes en un futuro figura la construcción de su puesto donde piensa destinar un espacio para sus servicios de cosmetología.

loans.use: To build her store from bare materials.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Currently, Martha A. runs two businesses from her home: a phone shop started two months ago and a book store that is a month old. Before dedicating her attention to these businesses, she sold clothes in her home until she was encouraged to open a phone shop in her house. Seeing that people were asking if she also sold school supplies, and seeing that she had what was necessary for a shop, she decided to open a book store. What she wishes now is to reinvest since she would like to convert the book store into a bazaar. In this manner, she would be able to help her husband provide a better education for her children who are 16, 11 and ten years old.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Actualmente Martha A. maneja dos negocios en su casa. Un locutorio inaugurado hace dos meses y una librería hace un mes. Antes de dedicarse a la atención de sus negocios, ella vendía ropa en su casa. Hasta que su pesos se animo a abrir un locutorio en su casa. Al ver que la gente preguntaba si vendía también útiles de colegio y de ver que contaba con lo necesario para una tienda, decidió abrir una librería. Lo que gana por ahora, lo vuelve a invertir pues le gustaría convertir la librería en un bazar. Así podría ayudar a su esposo a brindarle una mejor educación a sus hijos de diecisiete, once y diez años.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for a book store.

loans.name: Jesus Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Dulce (pictured center with a black blouse) is a sweet 50-year-old woman who lives with her husband and grandchild in the village of Las Avispas Mamon. She has three adult children (ages: 35, 30, 28). Currently, she sells popular varieties of beans and vegetables at a small roadside stand, but she has big dreams for her future. She wants to open up a school/community center for homeless children in the area. She said that she already knows exactly what building she wants to buy, but she is just waiting to save up enough money to get it! She told us that she has wanted to do this for several years, but now she believes it will happen soon.

This community is located in Puerto Plata, on the north coast of the Dominican Republic. The group is pictured above with their loan officer at Esperanza's office in the capital city of the province. This will be the first loan for the entire group, and they are all very excited. The women come from both Haitian and Dominican backgrounds, and ages range from 23 to 50. This is a very dynamic and diverse group of women, and Esperanza is confident that they will be a great asset to each other and the community as a whole.

Oh behalf of the women, and Esperanza, we would like to thank you for your support and generosity!

loans.use: Purchase food staples for cooking

loans.name: Las Hermanas De Pantoja, Group 1

texts.en:
Oneyra lives in the suburb of Los Alcarrizos on the outskirts of Santo Domingo. From her home she has a small shop where she sells jewelry, makeup, undergarments and beauty supplies. She is asking for this loan so that she can have adequate capital to expand the products and merchandise that she is able to offer her clients. She knows that if she has a better selection she will be able to attract more clients and beat out her competition better!

Her dream is to move her business forward, keep expanding it, and to make better profits off of it. For her children, she hopes to provide a safe home and healthy environment so that they can grow up to become useful people to their communities. For herself, she hopes that her work ethic and success will provide a good example to both her family and her community.

In her free time she likes to pray that all of her dreams can be realized. On behalf of Oneyra and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support of her loan.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, jewelry, and other beauty supplies

loans.name: Hermanas De Pantoja Group

texts.en:
Beata is a 27-year-old woman who lives with her husband and five children in the suburb of Los Alcarrizzos on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo. She has a small business where she prepares and sells fried foods to her community members; she has named her business Friatura Beata. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy a wider variety of vegetables and meats to sell her community members—without more capital she is restricted to buying the same, lower-priced meats and vegetables.

Her dream is to see her business grow so one day she can have her own building. For her children, she hopes to see them continue studying so that they can be professionals one day. For herself, she wants to become something and be someone important in her community—she hopes that through her hard work she can achieve this.

Her biggest challenge in life is to never give up—she has to make herself always fight to arrive at the place that she envisions for herself and her family. In the little free time that Beata has she says that she loves to read the Bible.

On behalf of Beata and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support of her loan!

loans.use: Purchase meat and vegetables to cook

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa is a middle-aged woman who lives with her four children and one grandson in a community on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo. She has struggled for a long time to provide for her children, and ever since she and her husband separated, she has essentially been their sole provider.

Santa currently has a small business where she collects glass soda and beer bottles from restaurants and the streets, and then sells them back to their respective companies. Typically she gets paid a flat rate per pound for her bottles; however, with the help of this loan, two very important things will happen. First, she will be able to begin buying bottles from some of the local colmados (corner stores) at a very low rate so that she can turn a higher profit each week. After a few months of the increased profits, she will have enough money saved so that she can submit her paperwork to obtain a legal ID number in the Dominican Republic. Consequently this will help her further, because recognized and legal Dominican residents get paid a higher rate, per pound, for recycled glass material.

Santa is very grateful to everyone who is helping her to make this loan happen. And on behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, we too are thankful for your interest and support!

loans.use: Purchase glass bottles to resell

loans.name: Capullo De Rosa Group

texts.en:
Micheline (pictured far right) is a soft-spoken 27-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in the suburb of Los Alcarrizos on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo. She has started a business of selling undergarments, and has named it Exclusividades Micheline. She is asking for this loan so that she can purchase a larger quantity of undergarments and likewise be able to sell more to her community members.

Her dream is to continue extending her progress and business growth into the future, so that it is a reliable and long-term source of income for her and her family. She hopes to see her children move forward, continue their education and always advance as people and leaders in her community. She says her biggest challenge right now is to fight against the widely held belief in her particular community that they will always be poor, and that no one in her community has the potential to really improve. To advance, she has to not only work hard in her business, but also work hard to stay positive and optimistic.

In her free time Micheline likes to study and work on her business. On behalf of Micheline and everyone in her Capullo de Rosa Bank of Hope, thank you for your support of their loan and your interest in helping them overcome the odds to improve their lives in ways they only dreamed of before!

loans.use: Purchase undergarments for retail

loans.name: Xtan's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Xtan K.. She is currently in the business of vegetables selling and is requesting a loan to expand the existing business. Xtan is 60 years old and is a widow. She has 3 children ranging from age 25 to 30 who are living in separate households. Each week, Xtan makes approximately 210 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to rebuild her house.

Xtan is joined in her small group by Rose S., Lucia T., Anurina K., and Mary J.. Rose S. has a business in home-based brewery and wants to improve the production process. Lucia T. is currently working in a brewery and wants a loan to start a new brewery in her house. Anurina K. operates a grocery and wants to construct a shop. Mary J. is currently in the business of making cakes and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand vegetable business

loans.name: Busanzi South C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Linda K.. She is currently in the business of selling produce and is requesting a loan to add more capital. Linda is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant farmer for work. She has 4 children ranging from age 5 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Linda makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business. Linda has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Kinda is joined in her small group by Racheal K., Getrude N., Judith B., and Fida A.. Racheal K. has a business running a clinic and wants to purchase more drugs. Getrude N. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to stock more clothes. Judith B. operates a retail shop business and wants to add more stock. Fida A. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to uplift the business.

loans.use: To improve the quality and quantity of produce

loans.name: Busanzi South D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Kevin B.. She is currently in the business of produce trading and is requesting a loan to expand business. Kevin is 39 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 2 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Kevin makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business. Kevin has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Kevin is joined in her small group by Florence N., Annet N., Juliet T., and Aisha K.. Florence N. has a business in clothing sales and wants to diversify to a business selling shoes. Annet N. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to add capital. Juliet T. operates a business selling secretarial services and wants to purchase more reams of paper. Aisha K. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To add more working capital to produce business

loans.name: Busanzi South E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Monica N.. She is currently in the business of running a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to buy more oils and chemicals. Monica is 36 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 3 children ranging from age 6 to 14 and her children go to school. Each week, Monica makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy cattle for rearing.

Monica is joined in her small group by Justine N., Aisha N., Kamya N., and Jesca O.. Justine N. has a business selling rice and wants to expand her business. Aisha N. is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to add more capital. Kamya N. operates a business of produce sales and wants to boost business. Jesca O. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge.

loans.use: To purchase more salon equipment

loans.name: Ndifakulya West A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Joy N.. She is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Joy is 23 years old and is married. Her husband is a mechanic. She has 2 children ranging from age 4 to 8 and her children go to school. Each week, Joy makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy goats for rearing. Joy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Joy is joined in her small group by Kamida N., Harriet N., Betty A., and Zaituni N.. Kamida N. has a business selling matooke and wants to purchase in bulk. Harriet N. is currently operating a restaurant business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge. Betty A. operates a business selling cabbages and wants to boost business. Zaituni N. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to add capital.

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Lwaba East I Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jamawa N.. She is currently in the business of selling produce and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Jamawa is 38 years old and is married. She has 7 children ranging from age 2 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Jamawa makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Jamawa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jamawa is joined in her small group by Fatuma M., Scovia B., Madina M., and Loy N.. Fatuma M. has a business selling fruits and wants to expand to vegetable selling. Scovia B. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to add more stock. Madina M. operates a restaurant business and wants to add more furniture. Loy N. is currently in the business of selling produce and is requesting a loan to add to the business.

loans.use: To add to produce sales business and expand it

loans.name: Lwaba East J Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret N.. She is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Margret is 48 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant farmer for work. She has 3 children ranging from age 17 to 24 and her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Margret is joined in her small group by Sarah N., Harriet N., Justine N., and Christine B.. Sarah N. has a business in clothing sales and wants to stock more clothes. Harriet N. is currently operating a business in cassava selling and wants a loan to add to the business. Justine N. operates a business of selling hides and skins and wants to boost business. Christine B. is currently in the business of selling passion fruit and is requesting a loan to improve business.

loans.use: To add capital to charcoal business

loans.name: Kamukamu A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose K.. She is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Rose is 38 years old and is divorced. She has 5 children ranging from age 5 to 14 and her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

Rose is joined in her small group by Edith N., Alayisha N., Safina D., and Hadija S.. Edith N. has a business running a retail shop and wants to add more items. Alayisha N. is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to widen stock. Safina D. operates a business of selling fish and wants to invest in her business. Hadija S. is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To purchase large volumes of clothes and increase stock

loans.name: Kamukamu B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Babirye E.. She is currently in the business of produce sales and is requesting a loan to increase inventory. Babirye is 48 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 14 to 23 and her children go to school. Each week, Babirye makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business.

Babirye is joined in her small group by Joy K., Justine A., Maria N., and Irene W.. Joy K. has a business selling fish and wants to boost business. Justine A. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to purchase more fish from the lake shores. Maria N. operates a business selling clothes and wants to boost business. Irene W. is currently in the business of selling maize and is requesting a loan to add more capital.

loans.use: To boost and expand produce sales business

loans.name: Kamukamu C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Stella N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more shelves and stock. Stella is 48 years old and married. She has 6 children ranging from age 14 to 23 and her children go to school. Each week, Stella makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business.

Stella is joined in her small group by Beatrice A., Rehema N., Zaina K., and Jesca N.. Beatrice A. has a business running a retail shop and wants to purchase a fridge. Rehema N. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to boost her business. Zaina K. operates a business in clothing sales and wants to purchase more clothes to sell. Jesca N. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy more utensils .

loans.use: To purchase more shop items like soap, salt and flour

loans.name: Fida

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fida N.. She is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to diversify to fruit selling. Fida is 40 years old and is married with a husband that is a carpenter for work. She has 8 children ranging from age 20 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Fida makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy bulding materials

Fida is joined in her small group by Jane Nampinga, Annet Nabirye, Justine Kagoya, and Beatrice Nabwire. Jane Nampinga has a business in retail shop and wants to add in stock. Annet Nabirye is currently operating a business in charcoal sales and wants a loan to expand to bulk selling. Justine Kagoya operates a business of tailoring and wants to purchase more cloth fabrics. Beatrice Nabwire is currently in the business of fish selling and is requesting a loan to add in business.

loans.use: To increase inventory in retail shop business

loans.name: Thai Thi

texts.vi:
At her age, Mrs. Thái Thị Sáu, 55 years old, a member of the TYM Fund, branch number 13, looks young and very healthy. Her 5 children are grown up and able to support for themselves. She still raises pigs, the work she’s been doing for 10 years now. She releases pigs for pork regularly 3-4 times a year. She also has few cows for meat. She said that she would not depend on her children as long as she still healthy and able. She is applying a loan of 400USD to invest in her livestock business. 

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.  
  
Bước vào tuổi 55 nhưng trông chị Thái Thị Sáu, thành viên chi nhánh 13 Quỹ Tình thương còn rất khoẻ mạnh. 5 người con đều trưởng thành và có khả năng tự kiếm sống, chị Sáu vẫn tiếp tục công việc chăn nuôi chị đã làm từ hơn 10 năm nay. Hàng năm chị vẫn đều đặn cho xuất chuồng vài ba lứa lợn. Thêm vào đó, chị cũng mua vài con bò và bán lại khi được giá. Thu nhập bình quân 130USD hàng tháng đủ cho cuộc sống của hai vợ chồng già. Chị Sáu tâm sự: Mình đang còn khỏe, vẫn lao động tốt thì không nên phụ thuộc vào con vào cháu. Với suy nghĩ như trên, chị Sáu vừa đề nghị xin vay mức vốn 450USD để mua lợn con và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Kimombasa South A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Zidina N.. She is currently in the business of selling milk and is requesting a loan to add more capital. Zidina is 47 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children ranging from age 4 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Zidina makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a cow. Zidina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Zidina is joined in her small group by Aidah N., Zidah N., Hadijah N., and Stabuwa N.. Aidah N. has a business selling produce and wants to boost business. Zidah N. is currently operating a restaurant business and wants a loan to purchase food warmers. Hadijah N. operates a business of charcoal sales and wants to purchase in bulk. Stabuwa N. is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to purchase poultry feed.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge for pasteurizing milk

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Hương is 23, she lives in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An with her husband and 3 children. Her children are still young. She has discussed with her husband and decided to start pig raising. This type of work suits her because it still give her enough free time to take care of her children. With their savings and the loan from SEDA, she has bought pigs and cows. Her business is still small but it does help increase her family income. The weekly payment toward the loan is taken of by her husband. She hopes that when her children a old enough, she would have more time to tend her animals. This time she requests a loan of 400 USD to buy pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương, 23 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Các con đều còn nhỏ, chị Hương bàn với chồng vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Công việc này tiện cho việc chăm sóc các con. Nguồn vốn tự có cộng với vốn vay được chị Hương mua lợn và bò. Quy mô của dự án tuy chưa lớn những cũng giúp gia đình có thêm thu nhập. Khoản tiền hoàn trả hàng tuần do anh Hòa, chồng chị đi làm thuê hỗ trợ. Chị Hương hi vọng khi các con lớn hơn chị sẽ có nhiều thời gian cho việc sản xuất. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 400USD mua lợn con.

loans.use: Buy pigs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Thai Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Thái Thị Hạ is 47, she lives in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. She is a 4th year member of TYM. She has 8 children, 2 of them are attending vocational education. Like most other villagers she raises pigs and cows to increase her income. Every time she sells a pig, she uses the money to buy basic things for her house. 2 of her children are working and they really help her with the weekly payments of the loan. Mrs Hạ wishes to remain a TYM member for a long time even after her children become adults. This time she requests a loan of 450 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thái Thị Hạ, 47 tuổi, sống tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Trong 8 người con của chị có 2 người còn đang học phổ thông. Cũng như phần lớn các gia đình nông dân trong thôn chị Hạ chăn nuôi lợn và bò để tăng thêm thu nhập. Mỗi lần bán lợn chị Hạ lại có một món tiền mua sắm thêm vật dụng trong nhà. 2 trong số những người con lớn đã đi làm là nguồn hỗ trợ đắc lực cho mẹ trong việc trả tiền tuần. Chị Hạ mong muốn được tiếp tục vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế ngay cả khi các con đã trưởng thành. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị vòng này là 450USD

loans.use: Buy pigs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Hòa is 48 years old. She is married and has 6 children. She and her husband live with their youngest 2. Their other children are married and live on their own, some work far away from home. Her main occupation is raising pigs. Her income, from selling the pigs, is around 1000 USD a year. After joining TYM, Mrs Hòa had the opportunity to expand her animal husbandry business. Noticing that a cow would brings in more profit she has bought 1-2 calves to raise. She would sell the animals when the price is right. After a few successful rounds, she now applies for another loan of 525 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hòa, 48 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 người con út tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. 4 người con đầu của chị người đã có gia đình riêng, người đi làm xa. Công việc hàng ngày của chị Hòa hiện nay là chăn nuôi lợn. Mỗi năm thu nhập trung bình từ hoạt động này khoảng 1000USD. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ, chị Hòa có điều kiện để mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi của mình. Nhận thấy việc buôn bán bò đang mang lại lợi nhuận, chị đầu tư vốn mua 1-2 con bò về nuôi. Khi được giá chị bán bò thu lãi. Sau những lần thành công trước, vòng vốn này chị Hòa tiếp tục xin vay 525USD đầu tư cho hoạt động này.

loans.use: Buy calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 30 years old, lives with her husband and her four children in Hung Nguyen district, Nghe An province. Her life is very tough because all of her children are still small. If just depending on some perches of corn land, their family would not have enough to eat. She cannot work far from home either, because that means she would not have time to take care of her children. With this situation, Mrs. H. chose to stay home and breed animals. In order to buy piglets, Mrs. H. borrowed money from TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam). Since she pays the weekly repayments, at the end of each loan term, the amount of loan unpaid is not too much. Thus, she can keep most of the money she got from selling the pigs. Her family income increases significantly with each loan. All of her children are able to go to school. She wants to borrow 525USD to buy piglets.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị H., 30 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 4 người con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Cả 4 con đều còn nhỏ nên chị H. rất vất vả. Nếu chỉ trông vào vài sào ruộng thì không thể đủ ăn. Chị cũng không thể đi làm xa nhà vì như thế sẽ không có thời gian chăm sóc các con. Trước hoàn cảnh thực tế, chị H. chọn giải pháp ở nhà chăn nuôi. Để có tiền mua lợn, bò, chị đã tham gia Quỹ Tình thương và vay vốn. Số tiền vay được chia nhỏ trả theo tuần nên khi hết vòng vốn, số lãi thu được từ việc bán lợn hoàn toàn thuộc về chị. Kinh tế phát triển dần theo những vòng vốn vay, các con chị H. đều được ăn học đầy đủ. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 525USD về mua lợn giống.

loans.use: Buy pigs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
With two grown-up children, Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 55 years old, now lives with her husband and her youngest child. Although old age, Mrs. T. is still very hard working. Her main job is to breed cows and pigs. She uses her own fund and the loan from TYM (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) to buy the piglets. Each year she sells some litters of pigs, which brings her an income of about 1000USD. Besides jobs, Mrs. T. often participates in social activities in her group and branch. Her husband and children always whole-heartedly support her. She wants to borrow 450USD to buy piglets. Mrs. T. is now living in Hung Nguyen district, Nghe An province.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

2 người con lớn đã trưởng thành, chị Nguyễn Thị Tám, 55 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và người con út. Mặc dù đã tương đối nhiều tuổi nhưng chị vẫn tích cực lao động kinh tế. Công việc chính của chị Tám là chăn nuôi bò và lợn. Số tiền mua lợn được lấy từ nguồn vốn tự có của gia đình và vay Quỹ Tình thương. Mỗi năm chị cho xuất chuồng vài lứa lợn mang lại thu nhập khoảng 1000USD. Không những làm kinh tế, chị Tám còn thường xuyên tham gia các sinh hoạt văn hóa xã hội tại cụm, chi nhánh. Hoạt động này được chồng con chị rất hiểu và ủng hộ. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 450USD để mua thêm lợn con về nuôi. Chị Tám hiện đang sống tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An.

loans.use: Buy pigs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Kamukamu E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Yafuwa N.. She is currently in the business of running a butcher's shop and is requesting a loan to start a hides and skins business. Yafuwa is 49 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 20 to 30. Each week, Yafuwa makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in another business. Yafuwa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Yafuwa is joined in her small group by Topista N., Pamela T., Alice B., and Margret K.. Topista N. has a business in charcoal sales and wants to expand to bulk selling. Pamela T. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to add more stock. Alice B. operates a business in clothing sales and wants to purchase more clothes to sell. Margret K. is currently in the business of running a piggery and is requesting a loan to purchase pig feed.

loans.use: To diversify and start trading in hides and skins

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Miss Nguyen Thi L., 38 years old, lives in Hung Nguyen district, Nghe An province. She hasn't got married yet, and is now living with her old mother. Besides working on her 3-perch corn land, Miss L. also breeds cows and pigs to earn some extra income. She has been a member of TYM Fund since 2004, and never has she missed or repaid her payments late. Each year she sells three litters of pigs, and her average monthly income is about 140USD. This time Miss L. would like to borrow 450USD to buy pigs and food for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Luân, 38 tuổi, sống tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chị chưa lập gia đình riêng và hiện vẫn đang sống với mẹ già. Ngoài làm 3 sào ruộng, chị còn chăn nuôi bò và lợn để tăng thêm thu nhập. Tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2004 đến nay, chưa tuần nào chị chậm trễ trong việc hoàn trả. Mỗi năm chị bán ra khoảng 3 lứa lợn, thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng 140USD. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 450USD để mua lợn và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 55 years old, is a third year member of TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam).  Her five children are all grown up.  She now lives with her husband and their youngest child.  For more than 10 years, heir family main income has come from pigs breeding.  After deducting the cost of piglets and food for them, each year she earns some hundreds USD in profit.  This money is rather enough for her to pay for the living expenses.  One of the advantages she has is that her children all have their own jobs, and they sometimes help her with the weekly repayment.  This year, thinking that she is getting old, Mrs. H. intends to buy a cow, raise and later sell it.  This job is easier than breeding pigs.  She ask for a loan of 400USD.

 Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer. 

Chị Nguyễn Thị H., 55 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 3 của Quỹ Tình thương. 5 người con lớn trưởng thành, chị sống cùng chồng và người con út. Nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình hơn mười năm nay từ nguồn chăn nuôi lợn. Trừ chi phí mua lợn con và thức ăn gia súc mỗi năm chị H. cũng thu lãi vài trăm USD. Số tiền này cũng tương đối đủ cho các khoản chi tiêu hàng ngày. Một thuận lợi với chị H. là các con đều có công việc và hỗ trợ chị trong việc trả tiền tuần. Năm nay, thấy cũng đã có tuổi, chị định mua 1 con bò về chăn và bán khi được giá. Công việc này nhẹ nhàng hơn so với chăn nuôi lợn. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị H. là 400USD.

loans.use: Buy beeves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Kimombasa South B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fatina N.. She is currently in the business of produce sales and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Fatina is 28 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 3 to 13 and her children go to school. Each week, Fatina makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her children's education. Fatina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fatina is joined in her small group by Zipora K., Zaituna N., Salam N., and Annet K.. Zipora K. has a business running a restaurant and wants to buy more raw food and big saucepans. Zaituna N. is currently operating a business selling produce and wants a loan to add to her business. Salam N. operates a business of selling produce and wants to trade in bulk. Annet K. is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to increase the inventory.

loans.use: To add to produce business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N., 47 years old, is a third year member of TYM Fund (Kiva Partner). Her family includes her husband, her four children and herself. Their family's main job is farming and animal breeding. She uses her previous loans efficiently so her family income increases significantly. The cost of piglets and cows are increasing, however, causing her a need to borrow larger loan. Since her children are all grown up and have their own job, it's easier for Mrs. N. to make the weekly repayment. This time Mrs. N. wants to borrow 575USD to buy piglets and food for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngọc, 47 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 3 của Quỹ Tình thương. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 4 người con. Hoạt động chủ yếu của gia đình là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Các vòng vốn trước chị Ngọc đều vay và sử dụng vốn đúng mục đích nên mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế tốt. Giá lợn và bò hiện nay đều thường xuyên tăng nên chị Ngọc luôn muốn vay mức vốn cao. Các con đều đã trưởng thành và có việc làm nên việc hoàn trả tuần diễn ra thuận lợi. Vòng vốn này chị Ngọc xin vay 575USD đầu tư mua lợn giống và thức ăn chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy pigs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Tín, 50, is a 3rd year member of TYM. She lives in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An with her husband and 4 children. All her children are grown up. Her previous loans were used to raise pigs. She is a hard working woman, she tends her pigs very well so they are big and meaty. Every batch of pigs sold brings her a few hundreds USD. She also sells vegetables to increase her revenue. Despite her 50 years of age, she is in good health and active. This time she requests a loan of 450 to buy breeding pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Tín, 50 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 3 của Quỹ. Chị sống tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An cùng chồng và 4 người con. Các con chị đều đã trưởng thành. Các vòng vốn trước chị đều vay vốn đầu tư vào việc chăn nuôi. Với tính cần cù chịu khó lại khéo nuôi nên đàn lợn nhà chị Tín lúc nào cũng béo tốt, khỏe mạnh. Mỗi lứa xuất chuồng mang lại cho chị vài trăm USD. Chị Tín cũng thường xuyên chạy chợ mớ rau, mớ cỏ để có tiền trả tuần. Bước sang tuổi 50 nhưng trông chị vẫn rất khỏe mạnh. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 450USD mua lợn giống

loans.use: Buy pigs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N., 33, is living with her husband, 35, and 4 children, 3 of whom are still in school. Outside of farming her main job is pig-breeding. Whenever he is free, Mr. Thuyen (her husband) also joined in to help with the household works. To have enough money to buy pigs and cattle-feed, Mrs. N. decided to join TYM. After joining, not just getting the money, she also got help and advice from TYM staff in doing business as well as saving for the repayment. Due to her precise and carefully planning, their family has been able to make about 1000 USD per year. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 525 USD to keep on investing in breeding pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Nghĩa năm nay 33 tuổi còn chồng chị 35. Hai anh chị có 4 con, trong đó 3 cháu còn đi học. Ngoài làm ruộng công việc chính của chị Nghĩa là chăn nuôi lợn. Những lúc rỗi, anh Thuyên cũng chịu khó hỗ trợ chị trong việc gia đình. Để có tiền mua lợn và thức ăn chăn nuôi chị Nghĩa tham gia Quỹ Tình thương. Sau khi tham gia, không những được vay vốn, chị còn được cán bộ Quỹ hướng dẫn cách làm ăn, tiết kiệm để có tiền trả tuần. Thực hiện việc sử dụng vốn đúng mục đích nên hiệu quả kinh tế đạt được cao. Mỗi năm thu nhập từ hoạt động chăn nuôi của gia đình đạt trên dưới 1000USD. Vòng vốn tiếp theo chị Nghĩa xin vay 525USD để tiếp tục đầu tư vào dự án.

loans.use: Buy pigs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 50 years old, is currently in the 3rd year with TYM of Hung Nguyen. She is living with her husband and their youngest child who is in his last year of high school. Their first 4 children all has their own family or are currently working far away from home. Just like the majority of the people in this rural area, her main sources of earning are from the rice-paddy and cattle-breeding. Since joining TYM, Mrs. T. has always been able to repay the loan and gain some profit. The main reason for these success has always been her careful planning taking into account her ability and resources. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow another 450 USD to buy cows. Her family current income is about 130 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị T., 50 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 3 của Quỹ Tình thương khu vực Hưng Nguyên. Chị sống cùng chồng và người con út đang học năm cuối phổ thông. 4 người con đầu của chị T. đều đã có gia đình riêng hoặc đi làm xa. Cũng như phần lớn người dân nông thôn, công việc chính của chị là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ đến nay năm nào chị T. cũng thu được những khoản lợi nhuận từ vốn vay. Một trong những điều mang lại kết quả trên là chị thường lựa chọn những mức vốn phù hợp với khả năng hoàn trả của mình. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 450USD mua bò về nuôi. Thu nhâp hàng tháng của gia đình là 130USD.

loans.use: Buy beeves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., 50 years old, is a 4th year member of TYM. Working hard all those years to taking care of her 6 children has made her look much older than her real age. Her youngest child is still in the last year of high school. With only a small area of rice paddy and a lot of mouth to feed, Mrs. L. spent all her remaining time to cattle-breeding. She normally has about 6 or 7 pigs in the pen, each weight close to 80 kilograms. In addition to that, she also raised cow to sell when the price is high. Each year her family can make all the way up to 1000 USD. After planning carefully, in this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 575 USD to buy another pair of cows.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Liên, 50 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Thời gian làm lụng vất vả nuôi 6 người con khiến chị trông già hơn tuổi thực. Người con út của chị hiện vẫn đang học năm cuối phổ thông. Nhà chỉ có vài sào ruộng lại đông người nên thời gian rỗi chị Liên dành hết cho việc chăn nuôi. Trong chuồng nhà chị Liên thường có 6-7 con lợn, mỗi con trên dưới 80kg. Ngoài ra chị còn nuôi bò để bán khi được giá. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi hàng năm của gia đình chị Liên khoảng 1000USD. Dự án hiệu quả, vòng vốn này chị Liên xin vay 575USD mua 1 đôi bò.

loans.use: Buy cows

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Kimombasa South C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fatuma Z.. She is currently in the business of running a drug shop and is requesting a loan to stock more drugs to sell. Fatuma is 32 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from age 2 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Fatuma makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land for her children. Fatuma has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fatuma is joined in her small group by Daudi M., Suzan N., Zaina K., and Nulu K.. Daudi M. has a business selling clothes and wants to boost business. Suzan N. is currently operating a business in charcoal sales and wants a loan to expand to bulk selling. Zaina K. operates a business of cattle trading and wants to add more capital. Nulu K. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to construct a charcoal shade.

loans.use: To add working capital to drug shop business

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ho Thi N., a 4th years member of TYM is currently living with her husband and 3 children in Hung Nguyen, Vietnam. At 47 years old, she has been doing cattle-breeding for over 10 years. During previous years, all of her loans had been to invest in breeding pigs.
