On behalf of Miomis and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support of this loan!

loans.use: Purchase new clothing, jewelry and shoes in bluk at wholesale prices

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria lives on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo in the Dominican Republic. She sells mobile phones, and has applied for this loan so that she can expand her inventory of cell phones, prepaid phone cards, and phone products. Because mobile phones and mobile phone products are expensive, she is looking forward to taking this loan out and being able to invest in her business on a greater scale.

Her dream is to continue growing her business every day, and to be able to support her children and their families with some of the extra income she earns. She also says that she hopes to live for many more years, and continue to grow as a business woman, mother, grandmother, and person.

In her free time, Gloria loves to read the Bible and spend time with her family. On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, thank you for your interest and time in supporting Gloria!

loans.use: Purchase cell phones, prepaid phone cards and phone accessories

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Cesar David

texts.es:
The micro-empresario, Cesar David Hernández is 31 years of age. He is married with 3 children, two of whom attend primary school. He is a native of Bluefields and has had a convenience store for 2 years, which he started because he was unemployed. He lives in an area where there are only 3 stores, which means that he has many clients to sell his products to, despite the fact that he does not have a variety of products. This means that many clients have to go to other areas to buy what they need. For this reason señor Hernández needs a loan in order to buy the following:

100 kg of rice at US $ 38 dollars per 100kg, 100 kg of sugar at US $ 28 dollars per 100kg, 1 barrel of oil at US $ 30 dollars a barrel, 3 boxes of ivory soap at US $ 10 dollars each box, 2 packs of chlorine bleach at US 10 dollars each pack, 2 bags of toilet paper at US $ 6 dollars per bag, 2 boxes of colgate toothpaste at US $ 5 dollars each box, 2 boxes of tomato sauce at US $ 4 dollars each box, 3 cartons of eggs to US $ 5 dollars each carton, 2 boxes of milk (the small milk jug) at US $ 32 dollars each box, 2 boxes of magui soup at US $ 3 dollars each box, 2 boxes of 3 minute soups at US $ 8 dollars each box, 2 boxes of soup in jars at US $ 5 dollars each box, 2 boxes of instant coffee at US $ 4 dollars each box and 100 kg of beans at US $ 42 dollars per 100kg.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El microempresario Cesar David Hernández tiene 31 años de edad, es casado con 3 hijos, dos de estos estudian en nivel primario, es originario de Bluefields y tiene una pulperia desde hace 2 años, la cual por razones de mantenerse en el desempleo opto por comenzar este negocio. Habita en un sector en donde existen solamente 3 pulperías lo que le permite tener muchos clientes a quienes venderle sus productos, sin embargo no tiene variedad de productos por lo que muchos clientes tienen que ir a otros sectores a comprar lo que necesitan. Por esta razón el señor Hernández necesita de un financiamiento para comprar lo siguiente:

Comprar 1 quintal de arroz a US $ 38 dólares el quintal, 1 quintal de azúcar a US $ 28 dólares el quintal, 1 bidón de aceite a US $ 30 dólares el bidón, 3 cajas de jabón marfil a US $ 10 dólares cada caja,2 pacas de cloro magia blanca a US 10 dólares la paca , 2 bolsones de papel higiénico a US $ 6 dólares el bolsón, 2 cajas de pasta de dientes colgate a US $ 5 dólares cada caja, 2 cajas de salsa de tomate a US $ 4 dólares cada caja, 3 cajillas de huevo a US $ 5 dólares cada cajilla, 2 cajas de leche la lechera pequeña a US $ 32 dólares cada caja, 2 cajas de sopa magui a US $ 3 dólares cada caja, 2 cajas de sopas 3 minutos a US $ 8 dólares cada caja, 2 cajas de sopa de vaso a US $ 5 dólares cada caja, 2 cajas de café presto a US $ 4 dólares cada caja y 1 quintal de frijoles a US $ 42 dólares cada quintal.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale in his store: specifically, rice, sugar, oil, soap, bleach, toilet paper, toothpaste, tomato sauce, eggs, milk, soups, instant coffee, and beans

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 27.74 dólares.
La cuota real es de $ 27.74 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 27.74 dólares

loans.name: Esdras

texts.en:
Esdras J. P. is a friendly and outgoing 43-year-old man who lives with his family in the town of Los Alcarizzos, just outside the capital of Santo Domingo. He is asking for this loan so that he can open a Christian library/bookstore in his community.

This is an excellent business idea for many reasons. First of all, Esdras’ community does not currently have any sort of library, so the need for one is great. Secondly, Esdras says there is a strong Christian community in Los Alcarrizzos that has expressed interest in having a Christian library; he is very excited to be able to provide them with this service. Esdras is asking for this loan so that he can buy the books he needs to start his library/bookstore. He hopes to expand the library over time.

He recognises that it will be a challenge “to realize a Christian Library in the big Haitian community in Los Alcarrizzos and to meet the needs of the churches and leaders there.” He plans to both sell and rent his books out.

In his free time Esdras loves to write, read the Bible, and teach his fellow community members. On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, thank you for your interest and time in supporting Esdras!

loans.use: Purchase books for a community library/bookstore

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy baking ingredients and improve his bakery

loans.name: Las Manzanas, Bank Of Hope Group

texts.en:
Martha (pictured far right of Group 1) is a fun and energetic woman who lives with her three children in the town of Los Alcarizzos. She has a ‘colmado’¸ which is a small neighborhood grocery store of sorts, typical of many street corners in towns throughout the Dominican Republic. From her store, she sells fresh vegetables, rice, beans, canned goods, soaps, and toilet paper. She is asking for this loan so that she can purchase a better variety of canned goods, desserts and candies, and be able to keep her colmado better stocked. With a better inventory she knows she can retain her current client base, as well as attract new clients and beat out some of her competition.

Her dreams are to see her colmado grow, and to have it be the biggest and best liked place to shop in her community. She wants her children to have the chance to change their lives, improve their futures, and always enjoy the opportunities they are given. She personally hopes to be able to live a more peaceful lifestyle, one where she advances economically and doesn’t have to worry so much about having enough money to take care of everyone.

In her free time Martha loves to visit the hospital and spend time with the sick people who are often forgotten. She also goes to her local church every Sunday. On behalf of Martha, and everyone in her bank—Esperanza International thanks you for your support of her loan!

loans.use: Purchase canned food, desserts and candy

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Mrs. Prum S., 39, is a mother of 5 children and works selling grocery products, earning around $5 in revenue each day. Her husband, who is a construction worker, also supports the family income and normally makes on average $5 a day. One child is married and lives away from home while two work as laborers and two others are students. 

Mrs. S. needs this loan to purchase wood, cement, and other material to renovate her house. (Mrs. Prum S. is not available for picture, only husband)

loans.use: To purchase wood, cement, and other material to renovate her house

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea T., 33, is married with 3 children and works as a farmer growing a variety of vegetables. She earns an average of $4 a day. Her husband supports the family by working as a cow broker and earns about $3 a day in profits. The famly includes 3 children. One is married and lives separately, while two others are employed as casino staffs, earning $200 each per month. This money will be used to purchase one more cow to resell for profit. ( Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Chea T. is unavailable).

loans.use: To purchase one more cow to resell.

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Mrs. Ouch H., 56, grows vegetables for a living, together with her husband. They sell their cropsin the market and earn approximately $2 a day of profit. This couple has 3 children, one of whom is a garment worker with a salary $75 a month and one other is married and lives separately. She would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a water pump to water her crops in the dry season in case it is difficult to find water.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Chong

texts.en:
Mr. Chong P. and his wife married in 1972. They have seven children: three sons and four daughters. One of their children has married; three are garment factory workers, one is a construction worker, and the other two children are studying. Chong and his family live across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Chong and his wife are farmers. They have grown corn and cauliflower on the farm not so far from their house for twenty-eight years.

Mr. Chong P. is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $300 to purchase seeds and fertilizer for growing corn and cauliflower.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for growing vegetables

loans.name: Prot

texts.en: Mrs. Prot R., age 36, and her husband sells groceries, normally earning $15 of revenue a day. They have 3 children, all of whom are students. The couple will use this loan to purchase grocery products in bulk to save money and use the remainder to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk and renovate the house.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sakhorn L. (pictured with her daughter) is a widow with two daughters, both working in a garment factory. The famiL. lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sakhorn is a farmer. She has grown rice and vegetables on the farm near her village for almost thirty years. After harvesting, she sells the products to a middleman in the village. She is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $1000 to repair her house.

loans.use: repairing their house

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin S., age 31, sells groceries in the busy market in Phnom Penh city, making on average $5 a day of profit. Her husband, who is a doctor, contributes to the living expenses and earns approximately $4 a day. They have 3 children, all of whom are students. Mrs. S. will use this loan to purchase more groceries, as now she has many customers. She will use the remaining money to repair her house. (Husband is pictured because Mrs. Chin S. is not available).

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and for house repairs.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mrs. Leang S. is widow with two daughters, one of whom is married and lives outside family home. The other one lives with her and helps in selling grocery items. The family lives on a Mekong River island about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Leang started selling grocery items in 1993. She buys the products from the market in Phnom Penh for re-sale at her home. She is requesting a loan for the eighth time in the amount of $500 to repair her house.

loans.use: repairing their house

loans.name: Om

texts.en: Mrs. Om T., age 44, is a widow who sells groceries from her house, normally earning around $20 in revenue a day. She has 2 children, all of whom help her to sell the products. To improve her income, she would like to borrow from Kiva to purchase products in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase products in bulk.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun H., 36, lives on Koh Dach Island in the Mekong River. She has been married to Chhunnat Khim since 1994 and has two sons and two daughters. Three of her children study in a local school and the youngest one stays at home. She learned to weave from her aunty and started weaving in 1992. She sells her finish products on the island. Her husband is a construction worker.

Mrs. Savoeun is requesting a loan for the sixth time in the amount of $500 to buy silk material for weaving.

loans.use: purchasing silk material for weaving

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Vu

texts.vi:
Mrs Vụ is 38 years old. She is a nurse, she has clinic at home. She has 2 children who are attending school. Her husband, Lê Thanh Bình, works in construction. She applies for a loan to buy conic hats (traditional vietnamese hat, conic shape) to resell. She has never borrowed money before. She applied to BinhMinh cdc (SEDA) because she likes weekly payment arrangement

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vụ, 38 tuổi, là y tá khám chữa bệnh bán thuốc tại nhà. Chị đã có hai con đang còn đi học. Chồng chị Lê Thanh Bình là thợ xây. Chị tham gia vay 2006000 đồng để lấy vốn mua nón rồi để bán, tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu, nay chị tham gia chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì chị thích hình thức trả góp hàng tuần.

loans.use: buy conic hats to resell

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao S., age 47, is a cleaner in the company and earns approximately $2 a day. Her husband, Mr. Has Sivon, works as a motor-taxi driver and normally makes on average $5 a day of profit. They have three children, two of whom work in a garment factory; the other one is student. Mrs. S. plans to use the loan from Kiva to open a small business by purchasing pigs to breed. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy a motorbike for her son to ride to school. (Mr. is pictured because Mrs. Mao S. is not available).

loans.use: To buy pigs and a motorbike.

loans.name: Thi Tat

texts.vi:
Mrs Tất has 2 children who are still going to school. She has been selling plastic products for a long time. Her products are made with recycled plastic, these are of good quality and beautiful design. She has built a good base of loyal customers. She would like to borrow 2006000 VND to expand her store, adding more products to her catalog. She likes SEDA's loan condition and the ability to make weekly installment

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Tất có hai con còn đi học, buôn bán nhựa từ lâu đời. Sản phẩm chị làm ra từ nhựa tái chế nhưng mẫu mã đẹp lại bền chắc nên được rất nhiều người tin dùng và trở thành bạn hàng thân thiết của cửa hàng chị. Chị muốn vay 2006000 đồng để mở rộng cửa hàng, làm ra nhiều sản phẩm để bán hơn nên chị đã vay theo chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì chị chỉ phải trả hàng tuần với số tiền nhỏ.

loans.use: plastic products

loans.name: Vien

texts.vi:
Mrs N. T. Vien, 38, lives in the town of Cho, N. Xa. Her main occupation is animal husbandry. Her family's living condition is difficult. She has 4 children to feed so it's quite a big task. She makes about 70000 VND a day (~4.40 usd). She has never borrowed money before. For this loan her objective is to invest in her animal husbandry business. She really hopes to obtain this loan, she will be able to pay it back.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chi N. T. Vien,hien nay 38tuoi dang sinh song tai N. Xa-T. tran Cho.Chi song bang nghe chan nuoi va lam moi truong.Gia dinh chi rat kho khan,hon nua chi lai dang phai nuoi 4con.Ma muc thu nhap trung binh mot ngay cua chi chi dat toi muc 70nghindong/ngay.Tinh den gio chi chua tham gia vay von o dau.Muc dich vay cua chi la de dung cho cong viec chan nuoi cua gia dinh chi.Chi rat mong muon co the vay von cua cong ty vi de hoan tra hon nua lai rat de de tiep can.

loans.use: animal husbandry

loans.name: Thi Nhi's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs Nhị is 39. She does various tasks to earn a living: cultivate vegetables, raise poultry, sell grocery. Her family income is 100000 VND a day (~6.25 usd a day). She likes to borrow from BinhMinh cdc (SEDA) because of the weekly payment arrangement and the paperwork is simple. She requests 2006000 VND (125 usd).
Mrs Hồng is 26, she will use the loan to buy merchandise to resell
Mrs Đạt will use the loan to raise poultry and cultivate vegetables

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nhị, 39 tuổi, làm đa ngành nghề: trồng rau, chăn nuôi và bán hàng. Thu nhập trung bình của gia đình chị là 100000đồng/ngày. Chị chưa từng vay ở đây cả. Chị thích vay ở chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminhcdc vì thích hình thức trả góp và không phải thế chấp, nên chị vay 2006000 đồng để chăn nuôi gà.
Chị Hồng, 26 tuổi vay vốn bán hàng.
Chị Đạt vay vốn để chăn nuôi và trồng rau.

loans.use: Trồng rau, chăn nuôi

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Noriani

texts.id:
Living in a Hindu neighborhood opens an opportunity for Ni Nyoman Noriani to open a store, which sells Kamen (traditional Balinese costume) and various Hindu worship means. She started this business because her husband’s income as a farmer was insufficient to meet their household needs, particularly now that both their kids were in school. With an initial capital of $100, Ni Nyoman Noriani built her business. She sources her materials from a local market. Since she has been doing this for a while, she has a particular store where she buys her inventory. With a small capital, she obviously yields a small profit, which is just enough to provide food for her family. Ni Nyoman Noriani requested a loan through DINARI Foundation to increase her capital. With this loan, she can buy Kamen and worship means in bigger quantities and wider selections so that her customers will have more items to choose from. She hopes that this business expansion can yield a higher profit, which can support their household needs and her children’s education plans. Ni Nyoman Noriani is very grateful for the loan given through DINARI.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Tinggal dilingkungan yang penduduknya sebagian besar beragama Hindu membuat Ni Nyoman Noriani mempunyai peluang untuk membuka usaha berjualan Kamen ( pakaian adat Bali ) dan berbagai sarana keperluan sembahyang untuk umat Hindu. Hal ini dilakukan karena penghasilan suaminya sebagai seorang petani tidak mencukupi untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga. Apalagi sekarang kedua anaknya sudah duduk dibangku sekolah. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.1000.000.- Ni Nyoman Noriani membangun usahanya ini. Barang dagangan ia beli di pasar yang ada di kotanya, karena pembelanjaan dilakukan secara rutin maka sekarang Ni Nyoman Noriani sudah mempunyai langganan tetap untuk pembelian barang dagangan tersebut. Dengan modal yang sedikit tentulah keuntungan yang diperoleh pun sedikit, dan itu hanya cukup untuk kebutuhan dapur saja. Oleh sebab itu Ni Nyoman Noriani mengajukan pinjaman modal ke Yayasan Dinari ,untuk menambah modal usahanya. Dengan modal tersebut sekarang Ni Nyoman Noriani bisa membeli Kamen dan juga perlengkapan sembahyang dengan jenis yang lebih banyak lagi ,sehingga pembeli bisa memilih sesuai dengan selera mereka. Pengembangan usaha ini diharapkan dapat memberi keuntungan yang lebih banyak ,sehingga kebutuhan keluarga dapat tercukupi dan anak-anak bisa bersekolah kejenjang yang lebih tinggi. Ni Nyoman Noriani sangat berterimakasih atas pinjaman modal yang diberikan oleh Dinari.

loans.use: To buy Hindu worship means in bigger quantities and wider selections so that customers can have more options

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Tha

texts.vi:
Mrs Thả is 52 years old. She sells flowers to earn a living for a few years now. She has 1 child who attends school and lends her a hand. She also sells wood. Her family income is about 50000-60000 VND a day (~3-3.75 usd). She never had a loan before. She applied to BinhMinh cdc (SEDA) because she likes the weekly payment arrangement. She's requesting a loan 0f 2006000 VND to by seeds and manure.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thả, 52 tuổi, làm nghề bán hoa được nhiều năm nay. Chị chỉ có một đứa con đang vừa học vừa làm giúp mẹ. Ngoài nghề bán hoa thuần tuý, chị còn đi lấy thêm củi về để bán. Thu nhập trung bình của gia đình chị từ 50000-60000 đồng/ngày. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đây cả. Chị thích vay ở Chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì được trả góp nên chị đã vay 2006000 đồng để mua phân bón và hạt giống trồng hoa.

loans.use: buy seeds and manure

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Mr. Bun S. and his wife married in 1989. They have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of their children help them in doing farming and other two study in a local school.

Mr. Bun and his wife have been doing farming and selling bananas for ten years. They grow bananas and vegetables on their farm near their home. Beside growing crops, they buy bananas from farmers in the village to sell in Phnom Penh. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Bun S. is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $500 to buy bananas from farmers for re-sale.

loans.use: purchasing bananas from farmers for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Mr. Ya LOEUM and his wife married in 2005 and have one little son. Their home is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Ya has been a full-time employee of a company for eight years. His wife, Duch Thon, has been selling boiled corn for one year. She buys corn from farmers to boil for re-selling in the village school. Mr. Ya is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $1000 to use for repairing their house.

loans.use: repairing their house

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Mai

texts.vi:
Mrs. Mai, 38 year old, sells scrap metal and raises pigs. Her income is from 4-4.50USD a day. She’s never had a loan, now she is applying a loan of 150USD at Binh Minh, where she does need to have credit, to buy piglets.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Mai, 38 tuổi làm nghề đi chợ sắt vụn. Chị vay 2006000 đồng để chăn nuôi thêm tại nhà. Thu nhập gia đình chị trung bình từ 50000-70000 đồng/ngày. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Chị thích vay theo chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì không phải thế chấp và sẽ được vay lâu dài.

loans.use: Buy piglets

loans.name: Phoeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoeung C., 59, lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River. She has been married to Oeun PICH since 1979 and has three sons and two daughters. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home; two of her sons study in local schools and one of her daughters weaves silk at home.

Phoeung learned to weave and started silk production when she was eighteen years old. She sells her finish product on the island. Her husband has done farming and raised cows since 1965.

She is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $200 to buy silk material for weaving.

loans.use: purchasing silk material for weaving

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
Bahrom R. is 26 years old. He is married with one kid.

Bahrom is a cattleman. He has been breeding cattle for about 10 years. Currently, he has ten head of cattle in his household. The business is successful and generates a stable income, allowing Bahrom to support his family. His wife, who is pictured above, helps Bahrom look after the cattle.

Now, he is planning to purchase more cattle. For this purpose, he requests 600.00 US Dollars for a term of 6 months. Borrowing for the first time, Bahrom promises to be accurate when repaying the loan and thanks everyone for their trust and support.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to increase turnover.

loans.name: Simach

texts.en:
Mr. Simach N. and his wife have been married since 1972. They have nine children; three sons and six daughters. Four of their children have married and live in separate houses; other four children work in garment factories; and the youngest one studies in local school.

Mr. Simach has been a motor taxi driver for twenty-five years. His wife, Sokhum Sor, grows vegetables for selling and for family use.

Mr. Simach is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $300 to replace his old motorbike with a new motorbike for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba B. is 57 years old. She and her husband have raised four children.

Mahbuba and her family have run a business for 10 years already. Mahbuba bakes the national bread called “lepeshka.” She has her own bakery shop. Mahbuba is well-known in her neighborhood as a hard-working woman. Everyday, she bakes up to 500 “lepeshka.” The prepared products are sold from her bakery as well as in the local market. The business is successful and generates a stable income for her family.

Today, Mahbuba needs to purchase materials for her business, like the flour and fuel that are required for the operations of her business. For this purpose, she requests 950.00 US Dollars for a term of 9 months. Mahbuba is a repeat client for IMON and has a positive credit history. She wants to thank everyone for supporting her today and promises to be accurate in her loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchasing the flour and fuel required for baking the national bread, “lepeshka”

loans.name: Thi Mai

texts.vi:
Mrs. Mai, 38 years old, sells scrap metal and raises chickens and pigs at home. She has 3 school age children. Her income is 4-4.50USD a day. She’s never had a loan with anyone, now she would like to apply for a loan of 150USD with Binh Minh because it required no credit and has a weekly repayment plan. She’d use the funds of the loan to invest in her livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Mai, 38 tuổi làm nghề đi chợ sắt vụn và chăn nuôi lợn gà. Chị có ba con đều còn đang đi học. Thu nhập gia đình chị từ 50000-70000đồng/ngày. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Chị thích vay vốn của chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì chị được vay lâu dài và chỉ phải trả góp hàng tuần với số tiền nhỏ. Vì vậy, chị đã vay 2006000 đồng để mua cám cho gà ăn.

loans.use: Buy feed for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Thi Lieu

texts.vi:
Mrs. Liễu, 39 year old, sells scrap metal and does hired laboring. She has two school age children. Her income is 4-4.50USD a day. She’s never had a loan with anyone, now she would like to apply for a loan of 150USD with Binh Minh because it required no credit and has a weekly repayment plan. She’d use the funds of the loan to start a livestock business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Liễu, 39 tuổi làm nghề đi chợ sắt vụn và làm thuê. Chị có hai con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị chỉ có 50000-70000đồng/ngày. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu cả. Nay chị vay 2006000 đồng để chăn nuôi theo chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì chị muốn vay lâu dài và không phải thế chấp.

loans.use: Start a poultry business.

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.en:
Rahmat U. is 38 years old. He is married with three children.

Rahmat is a farmer. He has been working the land for more than 10 years. He now has 0,80 hectares of land, where he grows crops like garlic, onion, wheat, and others. The current business is his main source of income and generates a stable income for his family. Rahmat's father and wife are also involved in the business.

Now, with spring coming, Rahmat wants to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and fuel for working the land. For this purpose, he requests 600.00 US Dollars for a term of 6 months. Rahmat is borrowing for the first time. He thanks everyone for trusting and supporting him and promises to be accurate when paying the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer, pesticides, and fuel to work the land and grow crops.

loans.name: Thi Hai

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hải, 42 year old, has two school age children. Her income is 4.50USD a day. She’s never had a loan with anyone, now she would like to apply for a loan of 150USD with Binh Minh because it required no credit and has a weekly repayment plan. She’d use the funds of the loan to invest in her livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hải, 42 tuổi, có ba con nhỏ còn đi học. Chị vay 2006000 đồng để chăn nuôi thêm tại nhà. Thu nhập trung bình của gia đình chị là 70000 đồng/ngày. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Chị thích vay theo chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì được trả góp hàng tuần và sẽ được vay lâu dài.

loans.use: Poultry

loans.name: Chahongir

texts.en:
Chahongir K. is 26 years old. He is married and has one adorable little girl.

Chahongir provides taxi services. Actually, Chahongir started his entrepreneurial activities ten years ago. He used to shoot video of his neighbors' wedding parties and other family events. Thus, Chahongir saved sufficient money to purchase his car. Certainly, he could not afford to buy himself a new expensive vehicle. Instead, Chahongir purchased an old car that was produced during Soviet times. However, the vehicle is in rather good condition, and has allowed Chahongir to generate significant income for his family for the last seven years.

Now, he needs to purchase minor spare parts and tire-covers for the vehicle. For this purpose, Chahongir requests 600.00 US Dollars for a term of 9 months. This is the first loan for Chahongir and he promises to repay it on a timely basis. He thanks everyone trusting and supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts and tire-covers for his taxi.

loans.name: Norm

texts.en:
Mrs. Norm M. was married in 1983 and has five children; four sons and one daughter. 
All of her children are living under her custody and help her in doing business.

She has been in the business of buying and reselling small trees and flowering trees in the village. She began this business in 1983. Her husband is a soldier and gardener.   

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of $500. She will use this money to buy more small trees and flowering trees for reselling.

loans.use: To buy more small trees and flowering trees for reselling

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Tanti Harti

texts.en: Tanti Harti, 36, is married to S. who works as an ojek driver (motorcycle) and has no regular income; sometimes he can earn $4 a day. They have 2 children from their marriage. To help her husband support the family's needs, she makes flavoured ices then sells them to several small shops near her house. She can earn $3 a day in income. She is asking for a loan of $100 to expand her business and earn more for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expanding her little flavoured ice business

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mr. Sim S., age 74, a widower, is a construction worker who builds houses. He earns an average of $3 a day. He has eight children. Six of then married and live away from home, and two sell rice, earning $50 each a month. Mr. S. would like to use this loan to purchase construction tools to assist in his work.

loans.use: Purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Abdulhai

texts.en:
Abdulhai S. is 47 years old. Abdulhai and his wife have raised three children and now Abdulhai is supporting his parents.

Abdulhai is a market vendor. He sells office supplies in the local market. Abdulhai's wife, who is pictured above, helps him sell the goods in the market.

Abdulhai has been in this business for ten years already. The business is successful and generates a stable income, allowing Abdulhai to support his family and his parents.

Now Abdulhai plans to increase the range of office supplies he sells. For this purpose, he requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for a term of 6 months. Abdulhai is a client of IMON, with a positive credit history, and promises to repay this loan in a timely manner. He thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchasing office supplies in order to increase the range of goods he sells at the market.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
Farhod K. is 27 years old. He is married with two kids. 

Farhod provides taxi services with his vehicle. He has been in this business for five years. Farhod is a rather diligent and hard-working young man. He is ready to work from early morning until late at night in order to keep his customers and obtain new ones. 
Now, Farhod’s car needs repair. That is why Farhod requests 600.00 US Dollars for a term of 12 months. Farhod has proven himself as a reliable client and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.  He thanks all who support him.

loans.use: Fixing the vehicle he uses to provide taxi services

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mrs. Lang M., age 36, sells fish and variety of vegetables in a busy market, normally earning approximately $8 a day. Her husband fishes for a living. After catching fish, he sells his catch in the market to earn about $8 a day. They have 6 children, one of whom works as a garment worker with a salary $80 a month.

He aims to purchase a new motor for his boat to replace his old, unreliable motor and fishing equipment, such as nets. This will help him to catch more fish to sell in the market and increase the family’s income.

loans.use: Purchasing new motor for a boat and fishing nets.

loans.name: Thi Tat

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tất, 46 year old, is a widow with a young child. She cleans houses to make living and provide education to her child. She’s never had a loan, now that she is applying for one of 150USD from Binh Minh to buy tools and supplies for job. Binh Minh does not require members’ credit and has a easy repayment plan.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Tất, 46 tuổi, chồng mất từ sớm, có một con còn rất nhỏ. Chị đi làm thuê để kiếm tiền nuôi con ăn học. Chị chưa từng vay ở đâu. Chị thích vay vốn ở Chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì không phải thế chấp và được vay lâu dài, vì vậy chị đã vay 2006000 đồng để mua đồ nghề phục vụ việc làm thêm.

loans.use: Buy tools and supplies for job

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Mrs. Prum V., age 50, is a farmer who grows variety of vegetables in a plot of farmland. On average, she earns around $2 a day. Her husband supports the family income by working as a teacher in his village, making around $2 a day. They have 7 children, 3 of whom are married and live away from home. One child was employed by a garment factory with a salary $140 a month and 3 others stay at home to help mother grow vegetables.

In order to help her family get more income, Mrs. V. would like to request a loan from Kiva to open another business by purchasing grocery products to resell for profit. In the future, she will also buy pigs to breed.

loans.use: She will use this loan to purchase grocery products to sell for profit.

loans.name: Desak Putu Arsini

texts.id: Desak Putu Arsini tinggal disebuah rumah kontrakan yang sangat sederhana bersama suami dan dua orang anaknya yang kini sudah duduk dibangku SMU dan SMP. Setiap tahun Desak Putu Arsini harus mengeluarkan uang sebesar Rp.1.000.000.- untuk membayar sewa rumah. Pekerjaan suaminya sebagai sopir angkot tidak dapat mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga, apalagi sekarang  muatan sudah sepi karena kebanyakan masyarakat sudah mempunyai sepeda motor sendiri. Karena keinginan Desak Putu Arsini supaya anak-anaknya bisa bersekolah, maka ia berjuang keras dengan membuka usaha membuat kue-kue untuk sembahyang umat Hindu. Peluang ini didapat karena dilingkungan Desak Putu Arsini semua masyarakatnya memeluk agama Hindu, yang hampir setiap bulan memerlukan kue-kue tersebut. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.1.000.000 Desak Putu Arsini memulai usaha ini. Bahan –bahan seperti tepung,gula ,ketan ,alat-alat penjemuran dibeli di pasar. Dengan modal sedikit, tentu saja kue yang dihasilkan juga sedikit sehingga keuntungan yang diperoleh tentu pula sedikit dan hanya cukup untuk keperluan dapur saja. Karena keterbatasan modal tersebut maka Desak Putu Arsini tidak dapat melayani pelanggan dengan maksimal,sedangkan masyarakat yang membutuhkan kue sangat banyak. Oleh sebab itu Desak Putu Arsini mengajukan pinjaman Modal Kepada Yayasan Dinari, dengan harapan dapat melayani masyarakat lebih banyak lagi sehingga keuntungan yang diperoleh lebih banyak pula. Dan Desak Putu Arsini dapat menyekolahkan anak-anaknya ke jenjang yang lebih tinggi,dan ia mempunyai keinginan untuk dapat menabung agar nantinya bisa mempunyai rumah sendiri. Desak Putu Arsini sangat berterimakasih atas pinjaman yang diberikan Oleh Yayasan Dinari.

loans.use: Membeli bahan baku dan peralatan yang menunjang usahanya

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em S., age 38, is a mother of 5 children. She sells fish and eel with her husband in a busy market, earning around $30 a day. One of her daughters is a garment worker with a salary of $80 a month. This couple will use this loan to purchase more fish and eel to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and eel to sell in the market.

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Em Sareth and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Thi Dan

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dần, 39 years old, sells scrap metal and does hired laboring. She wishes she can get some loan to buy some piglets. Her family income, that including her three children’s, is 4.50USD a day. She’s never had a loan, now that she is applying for one of 150USD from Binh Minh. Binh Minh does not require members’ credit and has a easy repayment plan.

Translated from Vietnamese by nguN., Kiva volunteer.


Chị Dần, 39 tuổi làm nghề đi chợ sắt vụn và làm thuê. Chị mong muốn vay vốn để chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập hiện tại gia đình chị là 50000-70000 đồng mặc dù đã tính cả thu nhập của ba con chị (đều bỏ học đi làm từ nhỏ). Vì vậy cuộc sống khá vất vả. Chị chưa vay ở đâu vì thủ tục rắc rối, rườm rà. Nhưng khi biết nếu vay theo chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc chị không cần phải thế chấp sổ đỏ thì chị vui lắm và đã vay 2006000 đồng.

loans.use: Buy piglets

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan D., age 48, works sells a variety of a grocery products, normally making an average of $15 in revenue. Her husband supplements the household income as a policeman and earns about $2.50 a day. This couple has one child.

To expand her business, Mrs. D. would like to loan from Kiva to purchase a grocery products in bulk to save money and to meet her customers’ demand. This is the second loan for this family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products in bulk.

loans.name: Isok

texts.en:
Isok Abdulloev is 41 years old. He is married with three children.

Isok is an entrepreneur. In 1988, Isok graduated from the Polytechnic Institute in Ukraine, with a specialty in engineering. Unfortunately, he was not able to find a job in his specialty. At that time, being the head of his family, he decided to work the land and grow agricultural crops.

Two years ago, Isok started a business selling small cattle. This business became the main source of income for Isok and his family, generating stable profits and allowing the family to improve their living conditions.

Now Isok is planning to construct a covered enclosure for sheep. For this purpose, he requests 600.00 US Dollars for a term of 12 months. This is the first loan for Isok and he promises to repay it promptly.

loans.use: Constructing a covered enclosure for sheep

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina T. is 32 years old. Zarina runs a beauty salon. The salon provides various services, including hair styling, hair cuts, manicures, and the services of a cosmetologist. At the same time, the salon rents out wedding dresses and national dresses for various occasions. The salon is rather successful and generates a stable income for Zarina's family.

Now, Zarina is planning to purchase new wedding and national dresses to rent out. For this purpose, she requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for a term of 12 months. Zarina thanks all for supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: Purchasing wedding and traditional national dresses to rent to clients of her beauty salon

loans.name: Leok

texts.en:
Mr. Leok C. D., 64, is a widower who works as a motor-taxi driver, normally making an average of $3 a day of profit.
He has four children. Two of his sons are security guards and earn a salary of $120 a month. One works as a motor-taxi driver with his father, earning around $2 a day, and one daughter works in a restaurant in Phnom Penh city with a daily wage of $10 each day.

Mr. C. D. will use this loan to purchase a new motorbike to replace his old, unreliable motorbike. This loan is the second loan for him. (The motorbike in the photograph belongs to his son, who uses it to commute to work.)

loans.use: Purchase a new motorbike to replace his old, unreliable motorbike.

loans.name: Mohammad Nahim

texts.en:
Mohammad Nahim lives with his own family in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of 6 children. He has a small business. He has a plot of land which he cultivates. In all the seasons of the year, he is supporting his family with this business.

Mohammad has requested an individual loan to purchase necessity materials, specially seeds, so that his land can bring in more income. He is intent on helping his family and enrolling his children in better schools. He is happy with this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: purchasing necessity materials for his little farm

loans.name: Muharam

texts.en:
Muharam O. is 25 years old. She is married with two small kids.

Muharam is a market vendor. She has been selling fabrics to make traditional national dresses for more than 6 years. She is applying for a loan for the first time and hopes to expand her business with the help of the additional funding. At the same time, she wants to improve the condition of her place of business. By generating additional income, Muharam plans to improve her family's living conditions.

Muharam requests 2,000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars) for the term of 6 months. Borrowing for the first time, she thanks all for trusting and supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics to increase the range of goods and improving the condition of her place of business.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 39444

loans.name: Artimin Edi Heksono

texts.id:
Artimin Edi Heksono is a waste-taker who collects used items for recycling everyday. He sells these items to a used items pooling station owner. Artimin has a 2-year-old son. To meet his household needs, Artimin has to cover a 1.25-mile distance to collect these used items, which are made of plastic, aluminum, steel and glass. From this effort, Artimin can collect profits of $80 weekly. He uses this income to pay for his family needs, rents and savings for future needs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Artimin Edi Heksono adalah seorang pemulung, yang setiapharinya mengumpulkan barang-barang bekas yang kemudian dijual kepada pengepul barang bekas. Artimin mempunyai seorang anak laki-laki yang masih kecil dengan usia 2 tahun. Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya Artimin harus menempuh jarak sekitar 2 kilometer guna mendapatkan barang-barang bekas tersebut. Barang-barang yang dikumpulkannya berupa barang-barang yang terbuat dari bahan plastic, aluminium, besi, dan kaca seperti botol minuman. Dari usaha yang dilakukannya Artimin mampu mengumpulkan keuntungan sekitar 800.000 rupiah/minggunya dan hasil tersebut digunakan untuk biaya hidup setiaphari, membayar kontrakan, dan sebagian lagi di tabung untuk keperluan dimasa yang akan datang.

loans.use: To buy used items

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Gulam Naqashband

texts.en: Gulam Naqashband lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is the father of 3 sons, and all his sons are outside of Afghanistan. He is supporting himself and his wife. He has a small business growing crops. He has good experience since he has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Still he is supporting his family, and now he wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan so that he can work hard and cultivate all his land to make good income to help his family.

loans.use: To expand his little farming business

loans.name: Zinnat

texts.ru:
Currently, is the time to buy and sell cattle. Zinnat S. has one calf, she would like to purchase a cow because cattle is inexpensive now. Zinnat began this business because her husband was rearing animals. Then, he found a different source of income and she began to rear animals. Zinnat began taking care of animals when her husband had this business.

In the future the cow will give milk and she will be able to sell it. Besides, it will be possible to produce yogurts, and this will provide additional income. Zinnat and her husband have two children who help in this business. The children help transfer milk and sell it.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

В настоящее время сезон купли продажи скота. У Шокировой Зиннат есть теленок, она хочет купить к нему еще и корову, так как сейчас скот очень дешевый. Она этот бизнес начала с того, что ее муж занимался скотоводством, но у него появился еще один источник дохода, по этому он передал бизнес скотов Зиннат, она с начала его бизнеса ухаживала за скотом. Со временем корова будет давать молоко, и она сможет продавать молоко. Кроме этого можно будет изготавливать молочные и кисломолочные продуктом, и это будет дополнительным источником дохода. У них двое детей они помогают в этом деле, дети развозят молоко и продают.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Farruh

texts.ru:
Farruh S. is a 26 year old man. He has two daughters and a wife who stays at home with the children. He works fixing apartments. In his free time Farruh takes care of animals. Currently, he has one big cow. He wants to purchase another cow. This is why he came to MicroInvest for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Султонов Фаррух молодой человек в возросте 26 лет имеет двоих дочек и жену домохозяйку. Сам работает мастером по еврореионту жилых домов.В свободное время занимается уходом за скотом.В данное время имеет одну большую корову.Хочет купить еще одну.в кредит для чего обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Mirzoiskandar

texts.en:
Mirzoiskandar M. is 27 years old. He is married with one little daughter.

Mirzoiskandar provides taxi services with his vehicle. He has been in this business for the last five years. Mirzoiskandar tries to provide high-quality service while offering prices attractive to customers. That is why he replaced his vehicle's fuel supply system with one using gas as a fuel. However, now he is planning to change the old gas cylinder with a new one made of kapron, as this is safer for his clients. Thus, Mirzoiskandar is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable. It should be mentioned that the business already generates considerable income for his family. 
Mirzoiskandar requests 600.00 US Dollars for a term of 9 months for the above-mentioned purposes. This is the first loan for Mirzoiskandar and he thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing a kapron gas cylinder for the fuel-supply system of his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing two additional cows and fodder for his herd.

loans.name: Bahtier

texts.ru:
Bahtier U. is a 46 year old male who works as an electrical mechanic in the Somonkom telephone company. He has two children. His wife is a school teacher. Bahtier U. makes enough money to provide well for his family’s life. But he wants to purchase computer and related equipment for his son's 18th birthday. This is why he decided to obtain a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Урунов Бахтиер мужчина в возросте 46 лет работает в Сомонкоме в телефоной компании мастером электриком. Имеет двоих детей. Жена работает учительницей в средней школе. Урунов Бахтиер зарабатывает достаточно чтоб хорошо обеспечить жизнь семьи. Но для того чтоб обновить всю оргтехнику в доме он решил взять кредит, на день рождение своего 18 летнего сына.

loans.use: To purchase computer equipment for home

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.ru:
Bahriniso N. is a 36 year old woman with 5 children. She has a husband who moved to Almaty, Kazakhstan, to earn money. Bahriniso rears and breeds goats. Near her village there are very large fields; she lets goats out in the fields in the morning, and at night the goats come back. Currently, she has 40 goats. Bahriniso obtains a good additional income from the goats wool. She makes thread from wool and then sells it at the market. With her loan she wants to purchase 10 more goats.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Норчаева Бахринисо женщина в возросте 36 лет имеет 5 детей и мужа который уехал на заработки в Алма-ату.Сама Норчаева Бахри занимается откормом и размножением коз. У них в селе очень большие поля куда она каждое утро отпускает своих коз.а вечером они сами возвращаются. На данное время она имеет 40 козочек.С них она имеет хороший дополнительный доход с их шерсти. Она прядет прядь и оптом продает на базаре. Взяв кредит она хочет купить еще десяток коз.

loans.use: Purchase more livestock

loans.name: Lutfiniso

texts.ru:
Lutfiniso M. is 29 years old and has 4 children. Her husband is in Russia to earn money. Lutfiniso spends all of her time taking care of goats. Currently, she has 12 goats. She knits socks from thread made from goat hair. Since livestock is now cheap on markets, Lutfiniso wants to buy 10 more goats with the loan money.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Мамадрахимова Лутфинисо,29 лет имеет 4 детей муж на заработках в России .Сама полное время проводит по уходу коз.На данное время у нее 12 козочек.Она вяжет носки из кзьей шерсти.Т.к. сейчас скот дешевый на базарах,то она хочет купить в кредит еще десяток коз.

loans.use: To purchase goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing two new cattle and additional fodder.

loans.name: Thi Minh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Minh, 32 years old, has two school age children. She sells scrap metal and raises chickens and pigs. Her income is 5USD a day. She’s had loan before. All were paid off. She is applying for one of 150USD from Binh Minh. Binh Minh does not require members’ credit and has a easy repayment plan.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Minh, 32 tuổi, có hai con đang đi học. Chị làm nghề đi chợ sắt vụn là chính, ngoài ra ở nhà chị còn nuôi gà và lợn, vừa là để nhà dùng, còn lại thì đem ra chợ bán. Thu nhập trung bình của gia đình chị từ 50000-80000 đồng/ngày. Chị đã từng vay vốn ở ngoài và đã trả hết. Nay, chị muốn vay 2006000 đồng theo chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì thích hình thức trả góp hàng tuần lại không phải thế chấp.

loans.use: Poultry and pigs

loans.name: Vasila

texts.en: Vasila is 34 years old. She is a mother of 3 children. The H. family lives in Khachmaz town of Azerbaijan. Vasila has 2 years of experience in this business. Now, this woman needs a loan of $1200 to buy clothes for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Abdurahimov

texts.ru:
T. Abdurahimov, who was born in1943, is married and has 5 children. His wife stays at home and takes care of the cattle together with T.. She also sells kurut (traditional Tajik snack) on a market. T. has a lot of experience and knowlege about cattle breeding. Currently, he has 2 cows and 8 sheep. Since during the winter season the cattle prices drop, he would like to purchase two more cows. That is the reason why he is asking for this loan.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдурахимов Туран 1943 года рождения имеет 5 детей жена домохозяйка занимается также с мужем скотоводством.Также она продает на базаре курут.Туран очень хорошо разбирается в скоте.Сейчас он имеет 2 коров и 8 баранов.Хочет в сезонн когда скот дешевый купить еще пару коров.Для чего обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: To Purchase Cattle

loans.name: Sarah's Raha. Group

texts.en:
Sarah is 33 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 7 years old. She and her husband also take care of three other children, ages 23,16 and 13 years old. Sarah is a tailor. She started in 1994. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $290 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in tailoring, cosmetics, groceries and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Rukia's Raha Group

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 3 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other people, ages 40 and 25 years old. Rukia owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $290 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling cloth, chips, and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Ziyarat

texts.en: Ziyarat is married, and has one child. Her husband is pictured here. She and her family live in Khachmaz, and sells electrical goods for 3 years. Ziyarat and her family would like a loan of $1200 to purchase electrical goods to support their family and improve their  business.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods

loans.name: Theresia's Changamoto. Group

texts.en:
Theresia is 33 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 18 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 51 and 16 years old. Theresia sells cloth. She started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a bakery.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarum S. and her husband, Houn Tem, have been married since the Pol Pot regime. They have eight children; five daughters and three sons. Four of their children are married and live in separate houses, the other three children are studing in the local school, and one of her sons is a taxi driver. The family is about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sarum is a farmer. She grows rice in the farm near her village, since 1979. After harvesting, she sells some rice product to the middle man in the village and keeps some for family food. Her husband is a full time employee of an NGO in Phnom Penh. 

She is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $1000 for buying a car for her son to run a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a car for running a taxi

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Asirat

texts.en:
Asirat T. is 40 years old. She is married with four children.

Asirat is a market vendor. She sells clothing for kids and teenagers. The goods are purchased in the neighboring country, Uzbekistan, as well as in the domestic market. As a rule, Asirat trades in the central city market. However, the village where Asirat lives is located on the border with Kyrgyzstan, and Asirat has customers from this republic also. Asirat's business is profitable, allowing her to contribute significantly to the family budget.

Now, Asirat is planning to purchase new clothing for kids and teenagers for her business. For this purpose, she requests 300.00 US Dollars for a term of 3 months. She has a positive credit history for her three years of cooperation with IMON. Asirat thanks all for supporting her and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for kids and teenagers in order to increase the range of goods of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing four calves and fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Thi Tam

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tâm, 24 year old, has a young child. She collects and sells scrap metal. Her husband is a laborer. Their income is about 3USD a day. Their lives are hard and they are expecting another child. She would like to make a loan of 150USD from Binh Minh. Binh Minh does not require members’ credit and has a easy repayment plan.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Tâm, 24 tuổi, mới có một con nhỏ. Chị thường đi chợ thu mua phế liệu về rồi tái chế. Chồng chị là công nhân. Thu nhập của hai vợ chồng trẻ chỉ có 50000đồng/ngày nên cuộc sống rất vất vả nhất là khi giờ đây hai anh chị lại chuẩn bị thêm cháu nữa. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Nay, chị mong muốn vay 2006000 đồng từ chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì thủ tục thuận tiện, đơn giản lại chỉ phải trả hàng tuần số tiền nhỏ.

loans.use: Scrap metal

loans.name: Veronica's Raha Group

texts.en:
Veronica is 27 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 9 and 6 years old, and 7 months. Veronica owns a small grocery store and sells cloth. She started in 2007 . Every day, she works from 6.30am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell food and decorations.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Aisha's Raha Group

texts.en:
Aisha is a married woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 6 years old. Aisha owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 7.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $290 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have a beauty salon, a shop and sell charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Thi Thanh

texts.vi:
Mrs Thanh is 28 years old. She has 3 young children. She collects/buys waste metal then resells to recycling company. Her husband works in retails. Life is tough for them, their income is just 50000-70000 VND a day (3.15-3.75 USD a day).She has never borrowed money before. When she learned of SEDA with its easy loan condition, weekly payment & simple paperwork, she had applied for a loan of 2006000 VND to have more capital so she could buy more waste material.

Translated by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thanh, 28 tuổi, có ba con nhỏ. Chị thường đi chợ sắt vụn. Chồng chị là người buôn bán nhỏ lẻ. Cuộc sống gia đình chị rất vất vả, với thu nhập hàng ngày chỉ từ 50000-70000 đồng. Chị chưa từng vay ở đâu. Được biết đến những tiện ích mà chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc, như thủ tục đơn giản, cán bộ tận tình đến tận nơi phát vốn, nên chị đã vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn đi chợ.

loans.use: buy waste metal

loans.name: Twahiba

texts.en:
Twahiba is a 40 year old and is single woman with 3 children, ages 18,15 and 7 years old. Twahiba is a cloth seller. She started in 2002. Everyday, she works from 5am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

In the past, Twahiba has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 23 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, 1 1/2 years old. Farida is a timber seller, she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Farida has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more timber for her business.

loans.use: To buy more timber for her business.

loans.name: Thi Lien

texts.vi:
Mrs Liên, 33, has never borrowed money before. Her husband works in construction. Their family income is 80000 VND a day (~5 USD). She applied to SEDA for a loan because its condition is easy and paperwork is simple. She's requesting 2006000 VND to have capital to buy buy waste material to resell to recycling company.

Translated by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Liên, 33 tuổi, chưa từng vay vốn ở tổ chức nào. Chồng chị đi làm thợ xây để tạo thu nhập thêm. Thu nhập của gia đình chị hiện nay là 80000đồng/ngày. Chị thích tham gia vay vốn của chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì thủ tục đơn giản, gọn nhẹ, nên chị đã vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn buôn bán phế liệu.

loans.use: buy waste material

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 37 years old and is married woman with 1 child, age 10 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 18,16 and 15 years old. Khadija owns a small cafe, which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past,Khadija has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin S., 37, sells fish at a market and typically earns an average of $5 per day of income. Her husband works at a construction site and also earns around $4 each day. Sin S. has six children. One of them is employed by a private company and the rest of them are students. She would like to use this loan to buy more fish to increase her inventory. Another part of the loan will be used to buy more construction tools for her husband, and to repair part of her house. This loan will change her family’s life and enable her to increase her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish and construction tools, and to repair part of her house

loans.name: Fatuma's Maarifa Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 39 years old and is married woman with 6 children, ages 24,22,18,15,8 and 6 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 23,22 and 19 years old. Fatuma sales bites and water from well, she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 6.30am to 8.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

In the past, Fatuma has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy other tapes for a well.. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Zainabu and Zuhura.

loans.use: To buy new tape for her well.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun L., age 28, is married with four little children and lives at SiemReap province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Moa Thea, works as a welder. He welds iron windows and doors and sells these products to brokers for a profit. Her husband handles all his family’s expense, while his wife, Mrs. Chhun L., works at home cooking food and looking after her four little children. Chhun L. has recently requested a loan to buy her husband a blowtorch, a metal cutting machine and other welding tools. Not only will these make his work easier, but they will also make him faster and more effective.

loans.use: To buy her husband a blowtorch and metal cutting machine, and other welding tools

loans.name: Rahel's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Rahel is 39 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 20,18 and 13 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 18 and 5 years old. Rahel owns a small stock for broiler chicks, which she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 5am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

In the past, Rahel has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her chicks. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in fish selling and kiosk selling.

loans.use: To buy more chicks for rearing

loans.name: Khen

texts.en: Mrs. Khen C., 58, a widow with two children, is a farmer living in Teok Nem Village, which is located in Kandal Province. One child is enrolled in a local school, and the other works as a tailor generating an income of around $5 per day. Mrs. Khen C. relies on her children because she has no income. She now requests a loan of $525 to build a new shop for her child and to buy beauty salon equipment as well as wedding clothes to rent to people for their wedding ceremony.

loans.use: To buy beauty salon equipment and wedding clothes.

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Mrs. Duong S. Ley, age 28, runs a butcher shop at a market. She sells chicken that she buys from her nearby poultry breeder in her community , earning around $5 each day of income. Her husband is an electrician and makes on average $5 each day. She has four little children. Mrs. Duong S. would like to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Mrs. Yun K. S., 31, sells porridge and makes around $6 each day. Her husband is a policeman and typically makes about $6/day in revenue. Mrs. Yun K. S. has three little children. She would like to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for family’s commute.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for family’s commute.

loans.name: Jamila's Ushirikiano Group

texts.en:
Jamila is 39 years old and is married woman with 3 children, ages 17, 13, and 10 years old. Jamila owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6am to 8.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $32 from her sales.

In the past, Jamila has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in cafe,cooking oil selling, cloth selling and charcoal selling.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Ying

texts.en:
Mrs. Ying D., 29, is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. Two of the children go to school. The other two are still too young.

Mrs. D. sells souvenirs around the campus of Angkor Wat temple, which is an exclusive and marvelous place for tourists. Each day, she can make on average around $5/day in revenue. Also, her husband works producing some traditional musical instruments, such as drum and Tro, and he contributes to her business by selling the instruments to tourists passing by. She has recently requested a loan to buy a motorbike to use for business transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to use for business transportation

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy Y. is married with two little children and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. To make a living, she runs a laundry for the people in her community. Each day, she can normally make around $4 in revenue. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver and earns around $5 each day in revenue.

Mrs. Thy Y. and her husband have recently requested a loan to purchase a piece of farmland and a hand tractor so that can grow rice crops and various kinds of vegetables. They will use the rest of the money to fill the land beneath her house to protect it from flooding during the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy farmland and a hand tractor to grow rice crops.

loans.name: Amina's Umoja Group

texts.en:

Amina owns a small medical store, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

In the past, Amina has taken out 1successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more medicine for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in soap and cloth selling,chicks selling and drinks and vegetable selling.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for her business.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Hanh C. is married with four little children and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She works with her husband on her farmland raising cows and growing rice. Recently, she and her husband have applied for a loan to purchase seeds and to build the rest of  her house to protect it from flooding and leaking during a rainy season.

(Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Hanh C. in not available.)

loans.use: To purchase seeds and build the rest of her house.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Mrs. Hem H., age 30, is married with two little children and lives in a Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She buys coconuts from the growers and resells them for a profit. She can earn about $2.50 each day. Her husband makes about $2.50 each day by working as a construction foreman. Mrs. Hem H. has applied for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business transportation

loans.name: Maimuna's Tumaini. Group

texts.en:

In the past, Maimuna has taken out 1successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending, vegetable selling and charcoal selling.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Mrs. Rim K. and her husband have been married for forty years. They have six children; two sons and four daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, and the other three have full-time employment, and the youngest one is studying.

Mrs. Rim and her husband have been doing farming for twenty years. They grow bananas, corns, and tomatoes in the farm near their home. Besides doing farming, her husband is a Khmer traditional musician. They are in early 60’s but still strong enough to work. The family lives in Mekong River’s Island about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Rim is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $1000 for growing bananas, corns, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Mboudy

texts.fr:
Mboudy is married and has been a member of the Village Bank of Ngollar for 5 and a half years. She has already received and repaid 11 loans without incident. She is asking for a twelfth loan to strengthen her business raising cattle. Mboudy has committed herself to repaying this loan at the end of 6 months in a single payment. The income from her business will allow her to take part in looking after her family. She is one of the best in her group.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mboudy est mariée, membre du BV de Ngollar depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle a déjà reçu et remboursé sans incident 11 prêts. Elle sollicite un douzième prêt pour renforcer son activité d'embouche bovine. Mboudy s'engage a remboursé le prêt au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance. Les revenus de son activité lui permettent de participer àl'entretien de sa famille. Elle fait partie des meilleures de son groupe.

loans.use: To buy livestock and food

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 38 year-old Magreth M.. She is single with one child, aged 15, and has two other dependents, who live with her because they are orphans.

In 2004, Magreth established a pharmacy. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA. She now requires a new loan in order to increase her inventory of medicines. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of medicines

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:

Mrs. Ly has been in the business of selling silk products for two years. She buys finished products from weavers in her village for resale in Sihanouk Ville City twice a month. She earns US $130 net profit per month. Ly is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $1000 for purchasing silk products for reselling.

loans.use: For purchasing silk products for resale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Amina M., who is married with eight children.

In 2005, Amina established a café. Working five to eight hours a day, seven days a week, and assisted by her husband, she earns about $25.00 per month.Amina now requires a loan to purchase additional ingredients in bulk, such as rice, flour, beans, and fish. In the future, she plans to also increase the quantity and range of her dishes. She thanks you for your support.

Keep in mind that when you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is "restaurant" or "café," you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide. But if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local--rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana)--and served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Joanitha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Joanitha B.. She is married with two children, aged 9 months and 8 years, and has one other dependent, who lives with her because she is schooling in the area.

In 2004, Joanitha established a pharmacy and soft drinks business. Working nine to twelve hours a day, and assisted by her husband and two employees, she earns about $1500.00 per month. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan to purchase additional stock in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $260.00. In the future, Joanitha also plans to diversify her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her pharmacy and soft drinks business

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment–a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothing for her business
