loans.name: Doeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Doeun C., 53, is a widow with three children; one son and two daughters. Two of her children have been married and living in separate households. Currently, Doeun is living with her younger sister and one of her children on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Doeun and her younger sister learned to weave from their mother and started silk production 1979. They have three looms in the family. They sell their finished products inside the island. 

Doeun is requesting a loan for the sixth time in the amount of $700 to buy silk material for weaving.

loans.use: For purchasing silk material for weaving.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Kiwalazi East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret N.. She is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to purchase more fish from the nearby shore. Margret is 36 years old and is married. She has 8 children ranging from age 3 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her household and family needs.

Margret is joined in her small group by Florence A., Merinzi J., Sulaina N., and Aisha N.. Florence A. has a business selling fuel and wants to boost her business. Merinzi J. is currently operating a business selling tomatoes and wants a loan to purchase more tomatoes to sell. Sulaina N. operates a business in charcoal sales and wants to construct a charcoal store. Aisha N. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to add to her business.

loans.use: To increase fish purchases

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C. (pictured with sugarcane juice machine), 45, is a widow with three children; one son and two daughters. All of her children have been married. Her oldest daughter lives in a separate household and her second daughter and the youngest son live with her on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her second daughter is a hairdresser and her son sells sugarcane juice and meatballs around the village via his old motorbike.

Mrs. Sopheap is in the business of weaving silk. She learned weaving from her mother and started silk production 1981. She sells her finished products in her village.

She is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $500 to buy a motorbike to replace the old one for her son’s business.

loans.use: For purchasing a motorbike

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mahit

texts.en:
Mr. Mahit T. and his wife, Rokiyas Sos, have been married since 2001 and have one son and one daughter. Both husband and wife don’t have their own house and live with their parents. The house is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Mahit has been fishing in the Mekong River, to sell fish, since he was young. Besides fishing, he also sells personal beauty products. He bought the products from market in Phnom Penh for resale in the nearby province. His wife has been selling fish since she was ten years old. She bought fish from her village for resale in the nearby village.

Mr. Mahit is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $600 to purchase a motorbike and for buying personal beauty products.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and personal beauty products for resale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 34 years old and is widow with 2 children, ages 15 and 8 years old. Christina owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 6.30am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $290 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Roeun N. and her husband live in the PrekLaung Commune of Kandal Province, in a small village north of Phnom Penh across the Mekong River. They have two daughters and three sons, all married and living in separate households. N. has been raising pigs for the past five years, while her husband has been employed as a mototaxi driver for the past four.  

This is the fifth loan N. is requesting from Maxima. Her pig-raising business has suffered since three of her pigs became sick and died, leaving only one remaining. She will use the $300 requested to purchase four new pigs as well as watermelon to sell from her home. The pig-raising business has become lucrative since the yield per kilo has risen from 5,000 riel to 8,000 riel. N. expects each pig will bring 60-70 kilo, for a market price of approximately 520,000 riel (roughly $133).

In addition to paying for family living costs, she is saving money to buy electronic equipment for her home (a television or stereo) so that she and her husband can have access to more information and news.

loans.use: To purchase 4 pigs and buy watermelon for resale.

loans.name: Marry's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Marry is 40 years old and is single woman with 3 children, ages 16-20 years old. Marry is a soap seller, she started in 2001. Everyday, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more soap items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in charcoal selling and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more soap for her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Veronica who has a business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business dealing in food vending.

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Rejoice E..  she is currently in the business of beer and local breweries and is requesting a loan to invest capital. Rejoice is 29 years old and she is married with a husband who is a peasant .she has 3 children ranging from age 2 to 11 and her children go to school. each week, Rejoice makes approximately 280 sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to open a deport .Rejoice is joined in her small group by Margaret A., Mary G., Tamara K., and Grace A..  Margaret A. has a business in bread and vegetable selling and wants to expand her business. Mary G. is currently operating a business in bread selling and wants a loan to expand her business.Tamara K. operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to expand the business.  Grace A. is currently in the business of selling beans and sugar and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in hair dressing and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Milka

texts.en: Milka is a 63 year old woman who lives with her husband in the town Derventa. Her husband is a pensioner and his monthly income is 450 KM. Milka is a pensioner too and she receives 400 KM monthly. This is her first loan  in the amount of  1,200 KM ($950). Milka  wants to use this loan  for purchasing seeds, compost and other materials for soil cultivation. She hopes that she will ensure an easier life for herself and her husband, because she will produce vegetables and she will not need to buy it.

loans.use: For purchasing seeds, compost and other materials.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 24, 2008)

texts.en:
Teddy is 43 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 14, 10 and 8 years old. Teddy is a tailor, a business she started many years ago. Every day, she works from 8:30am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business dealing in batik selling.

Gospa sews and Gospa will use this loan for buying spare parts for her sewing  machine. She wants to repair the sewing machine in order to improve and increase their monthly income.

loans.use: For buying spare parts for sewing machine.

In the past, Christine has taken out 2 successfully repaid loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more shoes for re-sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in groceries, cloth, and mattress selling.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for her small business.

Marry is 32 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, one 5 years old and one 6 months. Marry owns a small pharmacy, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

In the past, Marry has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more medicine for her pharmacy. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in cloth selling,chips selling, and fish and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for her pharmacy

loans.name: Abir

texts.en: Abir is a 29-year-old woman. She lives with her husband and their 4 children in Borj El Barajneh. Abir is a hairdresser. This is her fourth loan from Al Majmoua. Abir is planning to buy new tools for her business. She is striving to help her husband support their family.

loans.use: To buy new tools for her business

Hassan is planning to buy new merchandise. With the increased income generated from the loan, Hassan wants to pay the university tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Diatou

texts.fr:
Born in 1972, Diatou is the mother of a family. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Hathioume in the Ziguinchor region for 6 and a half years. She sells brooms made in the traditional style from saplings. She has received 13 previous loans, all of which she repaid without difficulty. With the income from her business, she is able to support her family. Diatou is asking for this loan to strengthen her business and intends to repay it at the end of six months in one payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1972, Diatou est mère de famille. Elle est membre du BV de Hathioume dans la région de Ziguinchor depuis 6 ans et demie . Elle vend des balaies de fabrication artisanale faits à partir des tiges d'arbre. Elle a bénéficié de 13 prêts qu'elle a remboursé sans difficulté .Avec les revenus tirés de son commerce elle entretien sa famille.Diatou sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité et propose de rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule fois.

loans.use: To buy brooms

loans.name: Zuwena's Bustani B Group

texts.en:
Zuwena is a single woman. She owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her little salon.

In the past, Zuwena has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more supplies for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business dealing in livestock raising.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

This is the first time he has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua. Mohamad is planning to buy new merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for his mobile phone store.

Each week, Linda makes approximately 200 Sudanese pounds in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

Linda is joined in her small group by Raida G., Rose R., Joice D. and Jenty B.. Raida G. has a business selling beer and wants to expand the business. Rose R. is currently operating a business selling vegetables and wants a loan to expand the business. Joice D. operates a business selling breads and wants to expand the business. Jenty B. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand their businesses.

loans.name: Nile Lending Group

texts.en:
The chairperson of the group, Alice E., operates a general store operating from her home. She has run the business for seven years and has recently expanded to selling cold drinks from her refridgerator. The cold drinks are her most profitable line and she is looking to grow this area of her business.

Alice is 32 years old and is married to a farmer and has two children, aged 18 and 20. She also supports her late sister’s two children aged 3 and 6 years.

Alice is representative of the hard working men and women of this group and will be responsible for encouraging the group’s members to repay the loan.

loans.use: The members of The Nile Lending Group want a group loan to support their various businesses and trades. Alice Ekitna, the group’s chairperson, want a loan to purchase salt, sugar, soft drinks and other household food items for her general store.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en: Amira is a 52-year-old woman. She lives with her husband in Borj El Barajneh. Amira is a sock wholesaler. This is her fourth loan from Al Majmoua. Amira is planning to buy new merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Fatima

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Born in 1950, Aissatou has been a member of the Village Bank of Hathioume for 7 years and has received 17 loans, all of which she has repaid without problems. She buys and re-sells brooms made in the traditional fashion out of saplings. She is the mother of a family. She has significant experience in this business, and her income allows her to meet the needs of her family. Aissatou is asking for this loan to strengthen her business and intends to repay it at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1950, Aissatou est membre du BV de Hathioume depuis 7 ans et eu à bénéficier de 17 prêts qu'elle a remboursé sans problème. Elle achète et revend des balaies de fabrication artisanale faits à partir de tiges d'arbres. Elle est mère de famille. Elle a une bonne expérience dans l'activité qu'elle mène et ses revenus lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Aissatou sollicite ce prêt pour poursuivre son activité et propose de rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy brooms

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 32-year-old man. He lives with his wife and their 2 children in Borj El Barajneh. Khaled owns a mobile phone store. This is his fifthloan from Al Majmoua. Khaled is planning to buy new merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sahar

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Jennys

texts.es:
Jenny R. dedicates herself to renting rooms in her home located in the Cinco Pinos municipality of the city of Chinandega. She is married and a mother and, as such, needs to support her small son and provide food, healthcare and a safe home environment to live in.

It needs to be said that the town of Cinco Pinos is very small, and hers is the only business of its kind. She needs to invest in the infrastructure of her business in order to provide a better service to her customers. For this reason, she has turned to Ceprodel which has helped her with credit that she has invested directly into improving her business and in this manner be able to better support her child.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Jenny R. se dedica al negocio de alquiler de habitaciones en su propia casa en el municipio Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es madre casada y con la necesidad de mantener a su pequeño hijo brindándole alimentación, salud y un techo digno donde habitar.

Es necesario destacar que el pueblo Cinco Pinos es muy pequeño y por tal razón su negocio de habitación es el único en la comunidad por lo que necesita invertir en su infraestructura para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio que preste las condiciones necesarias. Por esta razón ha acudido a Ceprodel quien le ha beneficiado con la entrega de créditos que los ha invertido directamente en el mejoramiento del negocio y de esta manera mantiene a su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: Improve rooms for rent.

loans.name: Virginia Isabel

texts.es:
Virginia Isabel G. Espina is a married lady with a small school-aged child for whom she must provide an education. For the past five years, she has dedicated herself to her small general store enterprise located in the Cinco Pinos municipality of the city of Chinandega.

Since starting her business, she has been known to be a hardworking person and has been able to maintain her nuclear family. One of the challenges she faces is the urgent need to buy supplies for her store, and for this reason she turns to Ceprodel to obtain credit that will allow her to stock her business. Her goal is to help support her household and provide an education for her child.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Virginia Isabel G. E. es una dama casada y con un pequeño hijo en edad escolar que tiene la obligación de mantener sus estudios. Se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 5 años en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Desde que inicio el negocio se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy esforzada ya que ha logrado mantener su núcleo familiar. Una de las necesidades que atraviesa ella es la urgencia de obtener dinero para la compra de los productos de pulpería y es por esto que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan comprar sus productos con el único fin de mantener su hogar y continuar dándole educación a su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for general store.

loans.name: Juan Ángel

texts.es:
Juan Angel T. is originally from the Cinco Pinos municipality of the city of Chinandega. For the past ten years, he has tended to his pharmacy business which he runs out of his own home.

He has four children, three of whom are still in school and for whom he struggles to provide for all their needs. To improve his financial situation, he has asked for credits in Ceprodel which, to date, has provided him with a total of nine loans. He has used these to purchase products to sell and, in this way, continue to support his humble household and provide an education for his children. He has a record of nine loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Angel T. es un caballero originario del municipio Cinco Pinos en la ciudad de Chinandega. Desde hace 10 años se dedica al negocio de farmacia teniendo su establecimiento en su propia casa de habitación.

Es padre de 4 hijos de los cuales 3 de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar por lo que tiene que esforzarse por brindarles todo lo que necesitan. Para mejorar su situación económica, ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel quien hasta este momento le ha brindado un total de 9 créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de los productos para comercializarlos y así seguir manteniendo su humilde hogar y además brindarle el estudio a sus hijos. Su record crediticio es de 9 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase pharmaceutical supplies.

loans.name: Gnima

texts.fr:
Gnima was born in 1960, and is the mother of a family. She has been a member of the Village Bank in Ziguinchor for 7 years and has always repaid her loans without incident. She sells brooms made in the traditional fashion from saplings. She is asking for this loan to strengthen this business, which she has managed for several years and allows her to meet her needs. Gnima intends to repay this loan at the end of six months in one payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Gnima est née en 1960, mère de famille. Elle est membre du BV de Hathioume à Ziguinchor depuis 7 ans et a toujours remboursé ses prêts sans problème.Elle vend des balais produits de façon artisanale à partir de tiges d'arbres. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer cette activité qu'elle mène depuis des années et lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins.Gnima propose de rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy brooms

loans.name: Ndella

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ndella T., 39 years old, has been a member of the Ngollard village Bank for 5 and a half years. She has benefited from 11 loans, which were all repaid without problems. She plans to raise cattle and sheep, a business in which she is well-equipped for. The income drawn from her business will allow her to maintain her household. To promote this business, she is asking for this loan, and proposes to repay it at the end of 6 months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mme Ndella T., agée de 39 ans est membre du Banc villageois de Ngollard depuis 5 ans et demie. Elle a bénéficié de 11 prêts qui ont été remboursés sans problème. Elle envisage de faire l’embauche bovine et ovine,une activité pour la quelle elle a une bonne expérience. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent d'entretenir son foyer. Pour promouvoir son activité, elle sollicite ce prêt et propose de rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy animals and food products

loans.name: Victor

texts.fr:
Mr. C. works as a cobbler in the town of Thies where he has been located for more than 15 years. He manages an industrial shoemaking business. He needs funding to strengthen his stock of raw materials and inputs. He sells his finished products at the local level and in Belgium where his brother lives, facilitating transactions and the purchase of production machinery.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr C. exerce une profession de cordonnier dans la ville de Thiès où il s’est implanté depuis plus de 15 ans. Il gère une activité industrielle de fabrication de Chaussures et de gangs. il a un besoin de financement pour renforcer son stock de matières premières et d’intrants. Il écoule son produit fini au niveau local et en Belgique où se trouve son frère qui lui facilite les transactions et l’acquisition de machines de production.

loans.use: Purchase of leather and hides to strengthen stock

loans.name: Atoumane

texts.fr:
Mr. Atoumane is a very energetic young Senegalese man without salaried employment; at an early age he launched himself into trading: purchase and resale of basic goods. He is located in the “Moussanté” market in Thies, where he currently manages a shop. The quick turnover of merchandise stock and the need for diversification necessitate substantial working capital, justifying this appeal for a loan.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr Atoumane est est un jeune senegalais tres dynamique sans emploi salarie ; tres tot il s' est lance dans le commerce commerçant : achat et revente produits de première nécessité. Il est installé dans le marché de « Moussanté »a Thies et gere actuellement une boutique . La rotation rapide de son stock de marchandises et le besoin de diversification, exigent un fonds de roulement assez important et justifie le recours a un pret .

loans.use: Purchase and resale of grocery products

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Mrs Seynabou F. was born in 1960, is married and has been a member of the Ngollar Village Bank for five and a half years. She has received 11 loans which have always been repaid without problem. Her business activity enables her to take care of the schooling of her children and day-to-day expenses. Seynabou is requesting this loan to strengthen her sheep business and plans to repay it after six months in one installement.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Seynabou F., née en 1960 , mariée est membre du Banc villageois de Ngollard depuis 5 ans et demi, Elle a bénéficié de 11 prêts qui ont toujours été remboursés sans difficultés. Avec son activité elle arrive à prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants et la dépense quotidienne. Pour renforcer son activité d' embauche ovine ,Seynabou sollicite ce prêt et propose de rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy rams and animal feed

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena is a hardworking 56 year old woman who has been working for as long as she can remember. She lives in the Laureles Sur area and is a single mother to three grown children, whom she is proud to have raised with a lot of effort selling new and used clothing door to door in municipalities outside of Managua.

She started her business the day that she decided to save the small amount of money that her parents would give her until she was able to buy her first bundle of clothing. It's been 40 years since then and nothing has stopped her from getting ahead in life. So much so that she has been able to buy each of her children a plot of land and helped them build their homes, modest as the one they grew up in, but theirs nonetheless. Now that she lives alone she would like to build a wall on the back of her small house in order to be more protected. She will pay for it with her work. Her biggest dream is that her children never forget the importance of hard work that she instilled in them.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Elena es un esforzada mujer de 56 años de edad quien ha trabajado desde que tiene uso de razón , habita en Laureles Sur y es madre soltera de tres hijos ya adultos a quienes con orgullo saco adelante con su propio esfuerzo vendiendo ropa usada y nueva de casa en casa en otros municipios fuera de Managua, inicio su negocio el primer dia que tomo la decisión de ahorrar el dinerito que sus padres le daban hasta que pudo comprar una primera paca de ropa de esto hace 40 años desde entonces nada la ha detenido para salir adelante, tanto así que les logro comprar a cada uno de sus hijos su terreno y les ayudo a construir su casa humilde como en la que nacieron pero con un techo propio. Ahora que vive sola quiere hacer en la parte trasera de su casita un muro que le de mas protección y que pagará con su trabajo, su mayor sueño es que sus hijos nunca pierdan el valor del trabajo que ella les inculcó.

loans.use: To build a wall on the back of her house

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es:
Sixta Dávila is 50 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur area with her life partner and three children, ages 5,8 and 18. Her partner is a merchant and currently sells hens at the markets. She helps with the household expenses by making tortillas by hand and preparing beans which she sells for breakfast, lunch and dinner out of her home. There is such a great demand for her tortillas that she practically spends the entire day in front of the burner making tortillas and selling them hot. For the past five years this business has helped with the family's finances, mainly to cover school costs for the children. Sixta hopes that in the future she can open a small general store where she can sell other basic products consumed by the residents of her neighborhood.

They have been able to improve their modest home with a lot of hard work and effort. The loan they are asking for will be used to buy four doors so that they can give their children a more secure and prettier house.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sixta D. de 50 años de edad, habita en los Laureles Sur, acompañada de su pareja de vida y sus tres hijos de 5, 8 y 18 años de edad. Su compañero es comerciante, vende gallinas en los mercados y ella lo apoya en los gastos de la casa, palmeando tortillas las que vende en su casa y cociendo frijoles y vendiéndolos para el desayuno, almuerzo y cena, su tortilla es tan demandada que pasa prácticamente todo el día frente al fogón palmeado maza para elaborar la tortilla vendiéndolas calientes. Desde hace 5 años este negocio ha apoyado en los gastos principalmente de colegio de sus hijos, en un futuro espera poner una pulpería y vender otras cosas básicas para la mesa de los pobladores de su barrio.

Con esfuerzo y perseverancia han logrado poco a poco mejorar su humilde vivienda, solicitan un préstamo para comprar 4 puertas para su vivienda lo que para ellos significa otro logro de su esfuerzo por darle a sus hijos un casita mas bonita y segura.

loans.use: Purchase of 4 doors for her house

loans.name: Gie Elybée Group

texts.fr:
GIE Elybée is a group of mixed male and female membership which specializes in cashew nut processing in Ziguinchor. Processed products are packaged in plastic bags and put up for sale by individuals and even hotels; the current loan is sought to strengthen the stock of raw materials.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Le GIE Elybée est un groupement mixte compose d' hommes et de femmes qui s' est spécialise dans la transformation des noix d’acajou a Ziguinchor. Les produits transfomes sont emballes dans des sachets plastiques et mis en vente a des particuliers et meme a des hotels ; le present credit est sollicite pour renforcer le stock de matieres premieres.

loans.use: Processing and marketing of cashew nuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in agriculture and various products for his business

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo A. S. originates from the Somotillo municipality. He earns a living selling diesel fuel to the people that pass by his business. For a long time he has worked to improve his family's financial situation and this is the main reason why he has invested in the purchase of barrels of diesel fuel to resale it.

Since he started this business he has obtained higher earnings compared to what he used to earn with his previous endeavor: the transport of people using a bicycle. It is important to note that he has been able to set up the sale of diesel thanks to the loans he has received from Ceprodel. The loans have enabled him to keep his business and to support his family. Currently his greatest need is to purchase more diesel fuel.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Arturo A. S. es un caballero originario del municipio de Somotillo cuya labor es la venta de diesel que oferta a los que transitan en el local. Desde hace mucho tiempo se ha preocupado por mejorar la situación económica de su familia y es por tal razón que ha invertido en la compra del diesel por barriles para luego comercializarlo.

Desde que inició su negocio ha obtenido mejores ingresos que los que obtenía anteriormente en su negocio de traslado de personas en una bicicleta. Es necesario destacar que su labor de la venta de diesel la ha llevado a cabo gracias a los créditos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel y por medio de estos ha comercializado este producto que le ha permitido mantener su negocio y llevar el alimento a su hogar. Hoy en día su mayor necesidad es la compra del diesel para continuar con su ardua labor en su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase of diesel fuel

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
The business that Ceferina does for a living is buying crops of ‘jicaro’ [a gourd-like fruit from which the seeds are toasted and then ground with other ingredients such as rice, cinnamon, and allspice to make the drink ‘horchata’]. She then runs the jicaro through a process which consists of burning the fruit and then removing, grinding, washing and drying the seed, and finally, packaging the product for sale. She has done this for a living for 20 long years with the support of her husband and her 5 young sons, sons for whom she needs to provide a good education.

She runs her business in the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. In order for her business to succeed, she needs to count on funds to buy the jicaro crops. It is for this reason that she has turned to Ceprodel to obtain the financing to improve her business through buying of the fruit for subsequent processing and selling of the product.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica la señora Ceferina es a la compra de los sitios de jicaro para luego pasarlos por un proceso el cual consiste en quebrarlos, extraer la semilla, molerla, lavarla, secarla y por ultimo empacarla para comercializarla. A este negocio se dedica desde hace 20 largos años con el apoyo de su esposo y de sus 5 pequeños hijos que por cierto tiene el deber de brindarles la educación que ellos necesitan.

Su actividad la lleva a cabo en el municipio Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Para lograr realizar este proceso debe de contar con ingresos que le permitan la compra de los sitios de jicaro y es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan el mejoramiento de su negocio por medio de la adquisición de estos productos para luego procesarlos y comercializarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of ‘jicaro’ fruit for processing

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Cristiano Eraso has been breeding cattle is his barnyard since he was very young. It is located in the Somotillo municipality in the city of Chinandega. He is a hardworking man and has been working most of his life in this business in order to support his family and to cover all their necessities.

Currently he wants to invest in his barnyard by buying a pregnant cow. He has come to Ceprodel to ask for the loan that will enable him to make this purchase, which in turn, will help him improve his family's financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La crianza de Ganado en su corral es el negocio al que se dedica desde muy joven el señor Cristiano Eraso en el municipio Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es un caballero muy esforzado debido a que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a este negocio con el fin de mantener su familia y suplir todas las necesidades de su hogar.

Su necesidad hoy en día es la urgencia de invertir en su corral y la compra de una vaquilla en preñez. Es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan realizar esta compra y así mejora su situación económica y la de su humilde familia.

loans.use: Purchase of pregnant cow to improve his barnyard

loans.name: Edita Emelda

texts.es:
Edita G. is a hardworking woman from the Somotillo municipality of the city of Chinandega. For the past 3 years she has been selling a variety of products from a small general store she has set up in her own home.

It is important to note that she is married and the mother of three school-age children. Edita and her husband work very hard to provide for their children. This is the reason why she is seeks help from Ceprodel in the form of a loan that will allow her to improve their financial situation and to get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Edita G. es una dama muy esforzada originaria del municipio Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Su negocio desde hace 3 años es la venta de productos variados teniendo su pulpería en su hogar de habitación propio.

Es necesario destacar que es madre casada y con 3 hijos en edad escolar. Junto con su esposo se esfuerza grandemente para suplir todas las necesidades de sus hijos. Es por este m0otivo que busca apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan mejorar su situación económica y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of assorted products

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
The sale of shoes is a very common business in the San Lorenzo market in the Somotillo municipality of the city of Chinandega. Francisco Mondragón has been earning a living in this business for the past three years with the purpose of caring for his home and his young son, who attends 4th grade in a local school.

In order to improve his business he has invested in the purchase of shoes. He has now come to Ceprodel to obtain loans that can help him buy merchandise from his suppliers and in this manner, offer more variety, better quality and prices to his clients. Currently he is in need to purchase more merchandise so that he can continue supporting his family.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de zapatos es un negocio muy común en el Mercado San Lorenzo del municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega. A este negocio se dedica el joven Francisco Mondragón desde hace 3 años con el único fin de mantener su hogar y a su pequeño hijo que cursa el cuarto grado de primaria en un colegio de su comunidad.

Para mejorar la condición de su ne4gocio ha invertido en la compra de los zapatos y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con Créditos que le permitan la compra de la mercadería a sus proveedores y así ofrecer mas variedad, calidad y a un mejor precio para sus clientes. Hoy en dìa su necesidad es la compra de mercadería para continuar con la manutención de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Irene Del Carmen

texts.es:
The business of a general store, or ‘pulpería’, is very common in the municipality of Somotillo in Chinandega, and thus there are many stores competing to attract clients. Nonetheless, Irene has been running this business for 4 years in the neighborhood.

She is solely responsible for supporting her child. Furthermore, she takes care of her old-age parents who need her help.

Ceprodel has been her source of unconditional support in providing loans, loans that she has invested in buying inventory. In this way upon selling the goods she improves her income so as to continue supporting both her child and her parents. She has worked with Ceprodel for one year.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de pulpería es muy común en el municipio de Somotillo en Chinandega por lo que existen varios de estos establecimientos que compiten por atraer a los clientes. Consiente de esto la señora Irene se dedica a este negocio desde hace 4 años en esta localidad.

Es madre de un hijo y con el deber de mantenerlo. Además tiene el deber de mantener a su sus ancianos padres que tanto necesitan de ella.

Ceprodel ha sido su apoyo incondicional brindándole créditos que los ha invertido en la compra de los productos y de esta manera al comercializarlos obtiene mejores ingresos para continuar manteniendo a su hijo y a sus padres. Su tiempo de trabajar con ceprodel es desde hace un año.

loans.use: Purchase of stock for a general store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: José David

texts.es:
José David is a young man whose business is the transport of people throughout the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. He has been doing this for a living for 4 years, starting with a small investment of his own with which he purchased a used bicycle, and over time he has continued to fix and refurbish it.

He is father to a newborn girl and thus now bears the responsibility to provide for all of her expenses. It must be emphasized that this young man works very hard at this business, transporting people from morning until dusk. The improvement to his bicycle taxi has been carried out with support obtained through Ceprodel, loans which he has invested in the repair of the bicycle in order to offer improved service to his clients. Now his need is the acquisition of resources to provide for corrective maintenance to his taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio del joven José David es la transportación de personas en todo el municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica a esta labor desde hace 4 años iniciando con un pequeño capital propio con el que compró una bicicleta usada y a través del tiempo la ha venido remodelando.

Es padre de una pequeña niña con el deber de brindarle apoyo en todos los gastos ya que es recién nacida. Es necesario destacar que este joven trabaja arduamente en este negocio, transportando personas desde la mañana hasta el atardecer. La mejora de sui medio de transporte loa ha realizado con el apoyo obtenido por Ceprodel el cual ha invertido estos créditos en la reparación de la bicicleta para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Hoy en día su necesidad es la adquisición de recursos para darle el mantenimiento correctivo a su medio de transporte.

loans.use: Repair of his bicycle taxi

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Juan Ramon is known for selling meat in the Somotillo market. He has been doing this for 15 years and has earned the appreciation of many clients who visit his business daily to buy beef.

In spite of his difficult economic situation, he has sacrificed a lot in order to move forward and give his 3 kids what they need to survive, such as food, a good home and an education so that they will do well as professionals in the future.

Nowadays his biggest need is the acquisition of meat to sell, and this is why he is looking for support from Ceprodel so that he can benefit from their loans that will allow him to buy meat to sell in the Somotillo market where he works.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Juan Ramón siempre se ha destacado por vender carne en el mercado de Somotillo. Su labor la realiza desde hace 15 años y hasta esta fecha se ha ganado el aprecio de muchos clientes que a diario visitan su negocio para comprar la carne de res.

A pesar de su difícil situación económica, con muchísimo sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante brindándole a sus tres hijos lo necesario para que puedan sobrevivir como lo es la alimentación, techo digno y los estudios para llegar a ser grandes profesionales en el futuro.

Hoy en día su mayor necesidad es la adquisición de la carne para comercializarla y por tal motivo busca apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan la compra de la carne y así comercializarla en el mercado de Somotillo donde labora.

loans.use: To buy beef/Compra de carne de res

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es:
Luz Idalia Lopez has been selling clothes and footwear in the market of Somotillo for three years. At the beginning it was very difficult as she did not have enough merchandise and she was often outside without earning a single cent on some days. Nowadays this problem has got better and she has stocked her business with a variety of clothes and shoes for all ages. She has achieved this thanks to Ceprodel as she has been able to obtain loans with them in order to buy merchandise.

Nowadays she again needs to get more merchandise to sell. This is how she helps to develop her home and betters her business' financial situation, which really needs this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La dama Luz Idalia L. se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado en el mercado de Somotillo desde hace 3 años. Sus inicios son muy duros por el motivo de que no contaba con suficiente mercadería y vendía al aire libre en ocasiones sin ganar ni siquiera un centavo. Hoy en día ha mejorado este problema y ha surtido su negocio con variedad de ropa y calzado para todas las edades. Este avance lo ha logrado desde que se alió con Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le han dado lugar a la compra de su mercadería.

Hoy en día su necesidad es adquirir una vez mas su mercadería para comercializarla. Es esta manera contribuye al desarrollo de su hogar y mejora de la situación financiera de su negocio que tanto necesita una inmediata inversión.

loans.use: To buy clothes/Compra de ropa

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
Maria E. makes and sells roofs for construction in the town of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. She has been doing this for 2 years now.

Nowadays what she needs most is to buy the materials needed to make the roofs, and for this she is counting on Ceprodel with the hope of being benefitted by one of their loans, which will allow her to improve her economic situation and therefore feed her 2 young kids where they live.

It is necessary to add that up until now she has had 2 loans, both of which have been paid off in time and in the right way.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La actividad económica de la señora Maria E. es la elaboración y comercialización de las tejas para construcción en el municipio Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica a este negocio desde hace 2 años.

Hoy en día su mayor necesidad es la compra de los materiales para la elaboración de las tejas y para esto acude a Ceprodel con la esperanza de ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan mejorar su condición económica y así llevar el alimento a sus dos pequeños hijos en su hogar de habitación.

Es necesario destacar que hasta este momento tiene un record de 2 créditos pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: To buy roofing materials/Compra de materiales para la elaboración de las tejas

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
Mario Alberto M. is an ordinary man in the region of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. He is a very responsible person that since his youth has been running a livestock farm with the goal of supporting his family, his wife and four children.

He needs to purchase calves and goats to reproduce them and maximize his profits by selling their milk and meats. Once that he has these products from his flock he sells them in his neighbourhood and in this manner he is able to support his family. To keep up with his business he has engaged Ceprodel for support, who in the past have provided him with loans that he has invested in the purchase of livestock, to keep his family's need met.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario Alberto M. es un caballero originario del municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es una persona muy responsable que desde su juventud se dedica al negocio de ganadería con el fin de mantener su familia que consta de su esposa y cuatro hijos.

Su necesidad es la adquisición de vaquillas y terneras para reproducirlas y sacarle el máximo provecho como lo es la venta de la carne y leche. Una vez que extrae estos productos del ganado los comercializa en su localidad y de esta manera mantiene su hogar. Para llevar a cabo su actividad Ceprodel le ha apoyado con créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de sus animales para continuar manteniendo su familia.

loans.use: To purchase a land lot.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Osiris Mileydi

texts.es:
The corner store business is a very profitable one because people use these to meet their everyday needs. Well aware of this Miss Osiris L. has been running her corner store business for the past 8 years in the town of Somotillo. She has her small store near a busy street and many pedestrians.

Her 4 small children are very proud to have such a hardworking mom and they suppor her and help her sorting out goods and products whenever they have some spare time after school.

For Miss Osiris L. the first and most important need is the purchase of products from her suppliers and this is why she had engaged CEPRODEL to obtain a loan. She will be able to continue running her business, importantly because it is the only income she earns to support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de pulpería es un negocio muy rentable debido a que las personas hacen uso de estas para suplir las necesidades que a diario atraviesan. Consiente de esto la señora Osirirs L. se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 8 años en el municipio de Somotillo teniendo su establecimiento en la cercanías de una carretera muy transitada por vehículos y peatones.

Sus 4 pequeños hijos se sienten muy orgullosos de tener una madre muy trabajadora y por esta razón le apoyan en su actividad ayudándole a despachar los productos siempre y cuando tengan tiempo libre cuando regresan de la escuela.

La necesidad primordial de la señora Osiris L. es la compra de sus productos a sus proveedores y es por esta razón que acude a CEPRODEL para obtener el crédito oportuno y así continuar con su actividad económica que es el único ingreso que posee para mantener a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rafael Alberto

texts.es:
The business of harvesting corn, maicillo (millet), and sorghum requires great effort since you have to be extremely careful with the process in order to obtain good basic grains that will sell. In the city of Chinandega, in the Somotillo zone, Mr. Rafael A. has worked in this business for the past 10 years, developing great work experience.

Rafael has four children, all school-aged, and as a responsible father he must cover their schooling and other expenses.

Despite his difficult economic situation, Rafael has been able to improve his economic status thanks to the loans that he has received from Ceprodel. He has invested them directly in the purchase of grains for planting, irrigation, and crop control. Currently his greatest desire is to be the best producer in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de cosecha de maíz, maicillo y sorgo requiere de mucho esfuerzo por el hecho que se debe de cuidar muy estrictamente la cosecha para lograr obtener Buenos granos básicos para luego comercializarlos. En la ciudad de Chinandega, en el municipio de Somotillo el señor Rafael A. se dedica a este negocio desde hace mas de 10 años y con mucha experiencia en este trabajo.

Es padre de 4 hijos todos estudiantes y por tal razón debe de cubrir tales gastos por ser un padre muy responsable.

A pesar de su difícil situación económica, el señor Rafael ha logrado mejorar su nivel económico gracias a los créditos que le he brindado Ceprodel habiéndolos invertido directamente en la compra de granos para la cosecha, trabajos de riego y control de la cosecha. Hoy en día su mayor anhelo es ser el mejor productor de su comunidad.

loans.use: To invest in the harvest of corn, sorghum and millet

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa Judita

texts.es:
Rosa S. is a very hard-working woman from the Somotillo zone in the city of Chinandega. For the past 15 years she has worked raising livestock such as pigs. She fattens them with concentrated feed and cares for them as they mature in order to later butcher and sell the meat.

Rosa is married with four children and is working to provide for their education and shelter. In order to continue in her work, Mrs. S. has requested a loan from Ceprodel in order to improve her economic situation and thereby continue caring for her children who need her so much. She has successfully repaid 5 loans through Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa S. es una dama muy trabajadora originaria del municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Desde hace 15 años se dedica al negocio de crianza de ganado como lo son los cerdos el cual los alimenta por medio de alimentos concentrados y cuida de su desarrollo para luego destazarlos y comercializarlos.

Es madre casada y con cuatro hijos que mantener brindándole estudios y un techo digno donde habitar. Para lograr llevar a cabo su trabajo, la señora S. acude a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan mejorar su situación económica y de esta manera lograr continuar manteniendo a sus hijos que tanto lo necesitan. Su record crediticio actualmente es de 5 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Raising of livestock

loans.name: Rubenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Rubenia’s business is located in her own home. It is a general store that she has run with great energy for the past ten years. The store is located in the city of Chinandega in the Somotillo zone.

Rubenia has three school-aged children and she is very proud that they are excellent students. She feels committed to continuing to improve her business in order to support her children.

In order to reach this goal she has contacted Ceprodel to request a loan that will allow her to purchase more product. She feels satisfied that her previous loans have allowed her to improve her economic condition and have helped her meet her children’s needs. Currently she needs to purchase more product for her store in order to obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de la señora Rubenia lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación siendo este una pulpería que desde hace 10 años ha venido supliendo con mucho esfuerzo en su localidad de habitación en la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente en el municipio de Somotillo.

Es madre de tres hijos en edad escolar de los cuales se siente muy orgullosa por ser buenísimos estudiantes y por esta razón se siente comprometida con continuar mejorando su negocio para apoyar a sus hijos.

Para lograr esta meta ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser apoyada con créditos que le permitan la compra de los productos. Es por esta razón que se siente muy satisfecha porque desde que ha recibido crédito ha mejorado su condición económica y le ha brindado todos lo que necesitan a sus hijos. Actualmente su necesidad es la compra de los productos para obtener mejores ingresos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Mr. Santos M. is dedicated to the business of planting and harvesting basic grains in the Somotillo township of Chinandega, Nicaragua. He has been working in the agricultural business since he was a child, learning from his father, who was always characterized as being an excellent field worker.

Currently Mr. M. is in need of tools for harvesting grains such as corn, maicillo (a native small seeded plant similar to millet), and sorghum. For this reason he has appealed to Ceprodel in order to receive a loan. This credit would permit him to improve his business situation and in that way help his family, who need so much from him, move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio que se dedica el señor Santos M. es la siembra y producción de cosecha de granos básicos en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica a este negocio de agricultura desde muy niño aprendiendo de su padre que siempre se caracterizo por ser un excelente trabajador en el campo.

La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa el señor Santos M. es la adquisición de las herramientas para la recolección de la cosecha como lo es maíz, maicillo y sorgo. Para esto acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan mejorar su situación del negocio y de esta manera sacar adelante su familia que tanto necesita de el.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting tools

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virgina V. has worked raising animals for the last 25 years in the municipality of Sauce in the city of Chinandega. From a young age she has been drawn to this kind of work with the animals. Today one of her most critical needs is to be able to fix her coral, as well as purchase another young dairy cow. With her income she has not been able to save the money.

With the help of Ceprodel, she will be able to make the necessary repairs as well as purchase the new cow to raise. She has had two previous loans with Ceprodel which she paid back within the required time.

La señora Virginia V. desde hace 25 años se dedica al negocio de ganadería en el municipio el Sauce de la ciudad de Chinandega. Desde joven se ha sentido atraída por el negocio de crianza de animales.

Hoy en día una de las necesidades que atraviesa esta humilde anciana es que debe invertir en la remodelación de su corral y en la compra de una vaca en preñez, sin embargo con sus ingresos no logra obtener este dinero y es por esto que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan mejorar las condiciones de su corral y además comprar la vaquilla para criarla y sacar la leche para comercializarla. Actualmente tiene un total de 2 créditos pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A NEW DAIRY COW AND MAKE NECESSARY REPAIRS ON HER CORAL.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: William José

texts.es:
William Caceres is originally from the city of Chinandega. He has run his business from his own location for four years, selling shoes for men, women and children. William is a single father, with the great responsibility of taking care of and educating his young son and providing for all his needs. Thanks to the loans from Ceprodel, he has been able to purchase more shoes for his business, generating more income which helps pay for his son's studies and other requirements.

William's greatest need is another loan to purchase more stock for his business, and continue to generate the necessary income.

William C. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente del municipio Somotillo teniendo su negocio en su propio local desde hace 4 años habiéndolo surtido con calzados para caballeros, damas y niños.

Es padre soltero y con la gran responsabilidad de mantener a su pequeño hijo en edad escolar el cual hasta este momento le ha suplido todas sus necesidades. Esto lo ha realizado gracias a los créditos que ha recibido de Ceprodel el cual los utiliza para la compra de zapatos y de esta manera, con la ganancia de las ventas beneficia a su hijo en los estudios y otras necesidades.

Hoy en día la mayor necesidad que tiene el caballero William C. es la urgencia de adquirir el préstamo para comprar los zapatos y así continuar brindándole a su hijo lo que el tanto necesita.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE SHOES TO STOCK HIS BUSINESS.   THE INCOME HE GENERATES HELPS THIS SINGLE FATHER TAKE CARE OF HIS YOUNG SON.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Xiomara Lissette

texts.es:
In the municipality of Somotillo, Senora Xiomara Mondragon has been selling clothing for ten years, starting her business with no location of her own, and selling very small quantities of clothing. She is married with one son, and together with her husband they do all they can to provide good care and education for their child.

She has been able to grow her business thanks to the loans from Ceprodel, which enabled her to buy more stock and improve her stand in the market of Somotillo where she works. Her greatest need now is to purchase more merchandise and continue to offer her excellent service to her clients.

En el municipio de Somotillo, la señora Xiomara M. se dedica desde hace 10 largos años al negocio de la venta de ropa comenzando el negocio sin tener absolutamente ningún tramo propio y vendiendo mínimas cantidades de ropa. Es madre casada y con un hijo que junto con sus esposo se esfuerza para brindarle la educación que el se merece.

Actualmente, ha logrado surtir su negocio y esto lo ha llevado a cabo gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel otorgándole créditos que los ha invertido en la compra de la ropa y mejora de su tramo en el mercado de Somotillo que es donde ella labora. Su necesidad mayor hoy en día es la adquisición de la mercadería pero una ves mas acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y así continuar en su bello negocio brindando un excelente servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER CLOTHING BUSINESS.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Armando José

texts.es:
Armando C. is originally from the municipality of Condega. For three years he has had a business selling gasoline and diesel. To begin this business, he needed the permission of the local authorities, and once he had that he began by selling to a small number of customers, slowly growing his business and increasing his customer base.

To continue to be successful, Armando has requested loans from Ceprodel to invest in more fuel. With the income from his work he is able to take care of his wife and three children.

El caballero Armando C. es originario del municipio de Condega quien desde hace 3 años se dedica al negocio de venta de gasolina y diesel teniendo una pequeña maquina que le permite traspasar el combustible por medio de una manguera. Para lograr tener este negocio solicitó un permiso a las autoridades del municipio y al habérselo otorgado inicio con la venta del combustible con pocos clientes y a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido ha venido incrementando su clientela y mejorando su actividad.

Para llevar a cabo su labor, el señor Armando C. ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel para invertirlos directamente en la compra del combustible y de esta manera mantener a su esposa y sus tres hijos que son su núcleo familiar al que tiene la obligación de mantener.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE GASOLINE AND DIESEL FOR HIS BUSINESS.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is 35 years old and lives with her 3 children and her husband in the area calld Ticuantepe. She has a few plots of land which she inherited from her father. For 15 years, they have grown pineapples, which grow well in the local conditions of this zone. She leaves very early in the morning to work on the harvest, sometimes hiring somebody to help, or sometimes getting help from her 3 children after they attend school. Her husband is a driver and with his salary they are able to cover their costs, but he often needs to work far away from home to earn more income.

La señora Margarita tiene 35 años, habita con sus 3 hijos y su esposo en el municipio de Ticuantepe, cuenta con unas manzanas de tierras que se las heredó su padre, las cuales ha venido trabajando, lleva 15 años produciendo piña, producto que mayormente se produce debido a las buenas condiciones ambientales que presenta el suelo y el clima en su zona. Desde muy temprano sale al campo a darle el debido mantenimiento a la cosecha, en ocasiones contrata a una persona que le apoya con el proceso productivo o a veces los mismos hijos le apoyan después de asistir a clases, esto con el propósito de que manejen todo el proceso de producción. Su esposo trabaja como conductor y por lo tanto cuenta con un salario fijo, el cual le permite a esta familia subsanar todos los gastos, el esposo trabaja fuera del hogar debido a la necesidad de percibir mayores ingresos, mientras la cosecha está por salir.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FERTILIZERS AND INSECTICIDES TO PREVENT ANY FUNGUS OR DISEASE IN HER PINEAPPLE HARVEST.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Aura Delia

texts.es:
The sale of cosmetics is a business that Mrs. Aura O. has dedicated herself to for the last 2 years in the region of Condega of the city of Esteli. She is a married mother and with the responsibility of 5 children in her charge she fights and makes an effort to satisfy all and every necessity. A problem that she has had to overcome is the necessity of obtaining cosmetics and due to her low economic income she requests credits from Ceprodel so that she can obtain the cosmetics from the suppliers and sell them so that she can keep maintaining her nuclear family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de cosméticos es el negocio al que se dedica desde hace 2 años la señora Aura O. en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí. Es madre casada y con la responsabilidad de cinco hijos a su cargo que lucha y se esfuerza para satisfacer todas y cada una de sus necesidades.

Una problemática que atraviesa la señora Aura es la necesidad de obtener los cosméticos y debido a sus bajos ingresos económicos solicita créditos en Ceprodel para adquirir los cosméticos que le proporcionan los proveedores y de esta manera comercializarlos para continuar manteniendo su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Felix Francisco

texts.es:
Felix C. is a young man well respected in his community of San Caralampio. He grew up in the country, and even at his young age is already a businessman and farmer. He is married and has a young son. His mother has been a good example to him, passing on her good business sense. She has a fruit stand in one of the main markets in the capital which generates good income. Now he needs a loan to be able to purchase materials needed for a successful harvest. Thanks to the unconditional help of his mother, this young man has been able to move forward with his dream of building his business and giving back some of the love and support he has always received from her.

Félix C., un joven ejemplar de su comunidad San Caralampio, creció en el campo y a su corta edad, es un agricultor y comerciante, es casado y tiene un hijo pequeño con ayuda de su madre que es su ejemplo a seguir y de quien heredó la habilidad del comercio y que tiene un puesto de frutas en uno de los principales mercados de la capital llamado Mercado Huembes, esto le dá buenas ganancias, ahora necesita su préstamo para comprar insumos de mantenimiento de la cosecha y tenerla lista a tiempo. Es gracias al apoyo incondicional de su señora madre que este joven a logrado salir adelante su sueño es un día con su trabajo y cuido retribuir a su madre al amor y apoyo que siempre ha recibido de ella.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS NECESSARY FOR A SUCCESSFUL HARVEST.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Carlos Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carlos C. is a man who has worked in the agriculture business since he was very young in the town of Condega in the city of Estelí. As the father of two children, he has managed to support his household thanks to his corn crop, which is the most important crop that thrives in the area’s climate.

To continue supporting his family, he urgently needs to invest in crop assistance that will improve the development of the corn. For this reason, he has approached Ceprodel for a loan that will allow him to improve the crop yield and thus get better results, greatly benefiting both his business and his household.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos C. es un caballero que se dedica al negocio de agricultura desde muy joven en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí. Siendo padre de dos hijos ha logrado mantener su hogar llevando el alimento gracias a la cosecha de elotes que es la mas importante que actualmente lleva a cabo por el clima de su localidad.

Para continuar manteniendo su núcleo familiar, necesita urgentemente invertir en la asistencia de la cosecha por medio de tratamientos que mejoran el desarrollo del elote. Es por tal razón que acude a Ceprodel para obtener crédito que le permita mejorar el rendimiento de la cosecha y de esta forma obtener mejores resultados que le sean de gran beneficio tanto para su actividad económica como para el mantenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: To invest in planting corn.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ileyda

texts.es:
Mrs. Ileyda R. is in the hair and beauty business, and for the past 16 years she has had a small salon in her house in the town of Condega. She is the mother of two school-aged children, and she puts a lot of effort into maintaining her business.

Mrs. Ileyda R. needs tools like scissors, haircutting machines, gelatins, combs, etc. She currently does not have these resources, so for this reason she is seeking support from Ceprodel to obtain loans that will allow her to acquire her tools and continue with her hard work. Her current credit record is seven loans paid on time and as prescribed.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ileyda R. se dedica al negocio de corte de pelo y belleza tendiendo su pequeño salón desde hace 16 años ubicado en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Condega. Es madre de 2 hijos en edad escolar y con el deber de mantener su negocio con mucho esfuerzo.

Para llevar a cabo esta actividad, la señora Ileyda R. necesita de herramientas como tijeras, maquinas de corte de cabello, gelatinas, peines, etc. Actualmente no cuenta con estos recursos y por tal razón busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan adquirir sus herramientas y continuar con su ardua labor en su localidad. Su record crediticio actualmente es de 7 créditos pagados en tiempo y forma según lo estipulado.

loans.use: To purchase tools for a beauty salon.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Irma Esperanza

texts.es:
Irma Esperanza C. is the mother of 4 children and dedicated herself to the business of selling vegetables in the city of Jinotega specifically in the region of Yali. All her life, she has lived in this area and since she began her business 17 years ago she has looked for a way to better her economic situation to care for her children. It is necessary to stress that she has been a very strong mother and has instilled good values in her children. Her necessity these days is to acquire the vegetables to sell them and for this she uses the help of a financier that Ceprodel provided her to obtain her products. Nowadays all the credits that she has requested have been paid off in the established time and manner.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Irma Esperanza C. es madre de cuatro hijos que se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras en la ciudad de Jinotega específicamente en el municipio de Yali. Toda su vida ha vivido en esta localidad y desde que inició su negocio hace 17 años ha buscado la manera de superar su situación económica para mantener a sus hijos.

Es necesario destacar que ha sido una madre muy esforzada y con buenos valores inculcados a sus pequeños. Su necesidad actualmente es la adquisición de las verduras para comercializarlas y para ello hace uso del apoyo financiero que Ceprodel le brinda para obtener sus productos. Actualmente todos los créditos que ha solicitado han sido cancelados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a los establecido.

loans.use: To purchase baskets of vegetables

loans.name: Lesbia Del Rosario

texts.es:
At the market in the town of Condega, Mrs. Lesbia B. sells vegetables, a business she has had for the past 10 years. Being a very cheerful person, she has earned the trust of many clients who have visited her daily to buy their products and thus she is able to support her two children as a single mother.

Since she does not have anyone else to support her, she has sought ways to improve her financial situation and for this reason she has received loans from Ceprodel that have allowed her to improve her business as well as the lives of her two children. Her greatest need now is to purchase vegetables from her suppliers, and therefore she again is relying on Ceprodel to provide her with the necessary credit to achieve this.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

En el mercado del municipio de Condega, la señora Lesbia B. se dedica al negocio de la venta de verduras teniendo su propio establecimiento desde hace 10 años en esta localidad. Por ser una persona muy alegre se ha ganado la confianza de muchos clientes que ha diario le visitan para comprar sus productos y de esta manera mantener a sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera.

A pesar de que no cuenta con el apoyo de otra persona por ser soltera ha buscado la manera de mejorar su condición economiza y para esto ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel que le han permitido mejorar la condición de su negocio y por ende la de sus dos hijos. Su mayor necesidad hoy en día es adquirir las verduras de sus proveedores y para esto confía que una vez mas CEPRODEL le brindara el crédito oportuno para llevar a cabo su actividad.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
In the region of Condega, in a humble home, Mrs. Maria V. dedicates herself to the baking of bread keeping an oven since she was more than 28 years old. Every day in the early hours of the morning Mrs. Maria V. prepares the dough to produce the bread and in this manner she sells it in her house where her clients come to purchase the product. To better her condition and business she has received credits from Ceprodel to acquire better quantities of bread and sell them with the proposal of obtaining an income to care for her 3 children that also need her support.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Condega, en un humilde hogar de habitación, la señora Maria V. se dedica a la elaboración de pan teniendo un horno desde hace mas de 28 años que es el tiempo en el que ella se ha dedicado a esta ardua labor de elaboración y venta de pan.

Todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana la señora Maria V. prepara la materia prima para elaborar el pan y de esta manera lo vende en su casa de habitación donde sus clientes llegan a comprar el producto.

Para mejorar su condición en el negocio ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel para adquirir mayores cantidades de pan y así comercializarlos con el propósito de obtener ingresos para mantener a sus tres hijos que tanto necesitan de su apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to produce bread

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
The region of Yali of Jinotega is characterized to be a town where hard working people live. One of these people is Mrs. Maria de Jesus R. who dedicates herself to the business of food sales offering all types of edible products. Mrs. Maria R. is married and is responsible for 2 children whom nowadays are studying in a small school in the region. A big necessity that she has to overcome is to quickly obtain merchandise to sell. For this reason she requests credits from Ceprodel to invest directly in the purchase of these products and care for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El municipio de Yali de Jinotega se caracteriza por ser un pueblo donde habitan personas muy trabajadoras. Una de ellas es la señora Maria de Jesús R. quien se dedica al negocio de pulpería ofreciendo todo tipo de productos tales como comestibles, para el hogar y personales.

La señora Maria R. es casada y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus dos hijos que actualmente se encuentran estudiando en un pequeño colegio del municipio.

Una gran necesidad que atraviesa esta dama es la pronta adquisición de la mercadería para comercializarla. Por esta razón solicita créditos en Ceprodel para invertirlos directamente en la compra de sus productos y así dar lugar al mantenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
In the city of Esteli, specifically in the town of Condega, Mrs. Martha Elena G., for the past four years, has dedicated herself very enthusiastically to her general store, a business she has established in her own home in this town. Among the products she offers are groceries, beverages, cosmetics, soaps, brooms, etc.

Today, she is in great need of larger quantities of products for her business. For this reason, she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will permit her to improve her economic situation and thus supplement her business to provide her children with a better lifestyle so that they can enjoy better household conditions. Her actual credit record is 4 credits.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

En la ciudad de Esteli, específicamente en el municipio de Condega la señora Martha Elena G. muy esforzadamente desde hace 4 años se dedica la negocio de la pulpería teniendo su propio establecimiento en su casa de habitación en este municipio. Entre los productos que ella ofrece se encuentran comestibles, bebidas, cosméticos, jabones, escobas, etc.

Hoy en día su mayor necesidad es la adquisición de mayores cantidades de productos para su negocio. Es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan mejorar su situación económica y de esta manera suplir su negocio para brindar a sus hijos y un mejor estilo de vida donde puedan disfrutar de mejores condiciones en el hogar. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 4 créditos.

loans.use: To purchase products for her general store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Marvin De Jesús

texts.es:
Marvin T. is in the agriculture business. He owns his own farm in the town of Condega where he plants grains and vegetables. He is a very confident man and very dedicated to his work since he works to sustain his household and care for his 4 children.

For the past 3 years, Ceprodel has contributed to the development of his business, offering him credits that he has invested in the purchase of grains and protection products for the crops. Today, this is his major necessity and therefore he has asked Ceprodel again, trusting that he will secure the requested credit to improve his crop.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad económica del C. Marvin T. es la agricultura, teniendo su propia finca donde siembra sus granos básicos y hortalizas en el municipio de Condega. Es un C. muy esforzado y con mucha dedicación a su labor ya que trabaja fuertemente en este negocio con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así mantener a sus 4 hijos.

Desde hace 3 años Ceprodel ha contribuido al desarrollo de su negocio brindándole créditos que los ha invertido en la compra de granos y productos de protección para la cosecha.
